en: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God.
hmr: Pathien Naupa Isu Krista Chanchin Ṭha hung tlung phutna chu.

en: Even as it is written in Isaiah the prophet, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, Who shall prepare thy way;
hmr: Zâwlnei Isai lekhabua, “Ngai ta, ka tirko i hmaah ka tir a, Ama chun i lampui siem a tih,”

en: The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make ye ready the way of the Lord, Make his paths straight;
hmr: Thlalêra mi khêk râwl chun, ‘Lalpa lamlien buotsai unla, A lampuihai suktlûn ro,’ a tih,” tia inziek ang khan.

en: John came, who baptized in the wilderness and preached the baptism of repentance unto remission of sins.
hmr: Johan, thlalêra Baptistu kha suksuolnahai ngaidamna dingin sim- na baptisma thu hrilin a hung suok a.

en: And there went out unto him all the country of Judæa, and all they of Jerusalem; and they were baptized of him in the river Jordan, confessing their sins.
hmr: Chun, Judai rama mi po po le Jerusalema mi po pohai chu a kuomah an feh a, an suolhai thupha chawiin Jordan vadungah a kuomah baptisma an chang tâwl a.

en: And John was clothed with camel’s hair, and had a leathern girdle about his loins, and did eat locusts and wild honey.
hmr: Chun, Johan chu sanghâwngsei hmul puonin ân thuom a, a kâwngah savun kâwngkhiin ân khit a, rama khuoizu le khâuṭhikṭhi buin a ring a.

en: And he preached, saying, There cometh after me he that is mightier than I, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
hmr: Chun, “Ka hnungah keia nêka ropui lem a hung zing a nih; kûna a kekawk hrui sût tlâk khawm ka ni nawh.

en: I baptized you in water; but he shall baptize you in the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Kei chun tuiin ka baptis hlak cheu a; ama ruok chun chu Thlarau Inthiengin a baptis ding cheu a nih,” tiin a hril a.

en: And it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in the Jordan.
hmr: Chuong nihaia chun Isu Galili rama Nazaretha inthawkin a hung a, Jordan vadungah Johan kuomah baptisma a chang tah a.

en: And straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens rent asunder, and the Spirit as a dove descending upon him:
hmr: Chuongchun, tuia inthawka a hung suok phingle chun, vân in- hawnga Thlarau vâṭhu angin ama chunga hung ṭum a hmu tah a.

en: and a voice came out of the heavens, Thou art my beloved Son, in thee I am well pleased.
hmr: Chun, “Nang ka Naupa dittak i nih, i chungah ka lungni bêk bêk a nih,” tiin vâna inthawkin râwl a hung suok a.

en: And straightway the Spirit driveth him forth into the wilderness.
hmr: Chu phingleh Thlarau chun thlalêrah ama a tir suok tah a.

en: And he was in the wilderness forty days tempted of Satan; and he was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Setan ithlêmin ni sâwmli zet thlalêra chun a um a, ramsahai lai a um a, vântirkohai chun a rawng an bâwlpêk a.

en: Now after John was delivered up, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of God,
hmr: Chun, Johan an man hnungin Isu, Pathien Chanchin Ṭha hrilin Galili ramah a hung a;

en: and saying, The time is fulfilled, and the kingdom of God is at hand: repent ye, and believe in the gospel.
hmr: “Hun chu a hung tlung tah a, Pathien ram khawm a hung hnai tah a, sim unla Chanchin ṭha hi ring ro,” a ti pei a.

en: And passing along by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew the brother of Simon casting a net in the sea; for they were fishers.
hmr: Chun, Galili dîl panghrûla a fe laiin Simon le Simon unaupa Andri chu dîla chun lên dêngin a hmuh a; nga mantu an ni hrim a.

en: And Jesus said unto them, Come ye after me, and I will make you to become fishers of men.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Mi zui ro, chuongchun, mihriem mantu dingin siem ka ti cheu,” a ta.

en: And straightway they left the nets, and followed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, lênhai chu mâk- sanin an zui tah a.

en: And going on a little further, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the boat mending the nets.
hmr: Chun, tâwite a hei fe chun, Zebedai naupa Jakob le a unau Johan chu a hmuh a, anni khawm chu an lênhai siemṭhain lawnga bawk an um a.

en: And straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired servants, and went after him.
hmr: Chun, anni khawm chu a ko nghâl tah a: chuongchun, an pa Zebedai chu inhlawfa an iruoihai kuoma chun lawngah an mâksan a, an zui tah a.

en: And they go into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue and taught.
hmr: Chun, Kapernaumah an va feh a, chun Châwlni chun inkhâwmna inah a lût a, ân chûktir nghâl tah a.

en: And they were astonished at his teaching: for he taught them as having authority, and not as the scribes.
hmr: A thu inchûktir chu mak an ti hle a, Dân inchûktirtuhai ang loa, thuneina nei taka anni ân chûktir leiin.

en: And straightway there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
hmr: Chun, an inkhawmna ina chun khawhri inthieng naw nei mi pakhat a lo um a;

en: saying, What have we to do with thee, Jesus thou Nazarene? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
hmr: ama chun, “Nazareth Isu, keini le nang ieng am ei inzâwlna a um a? Mi sukbohmang dingin i hung am a nih? Nang ka hriet che, Pathien mi inthieng i nih,” tiin a khêk suok nghâl tah a.

en: And Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold thy peace, and come out of him.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a hal a, “To la, a sûnga inthawkin hung suok rawh,” a ta.

en: And the unclean spirit, tearing him and crying with a loud voice, came out of him.
hmr: Chun, khawhri inthieng naw chun ama a sawisah a, inringtakin a khêk a, a sûnga chu a hung suok tah a.

en: And they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What is this? a new teaching! with authority he commandeth even the unclean spirits, and they obey him.
hmr: Chun, an rêngin mak an ti ta bêk bêk a, chuongchun, “Ahi ieng am a ni ta leh, inchûktirna thar a ni hi tên! Khawhri inthieng naw khawm thuneitakin thu a pêk a, a thu an awi pei el hi,” tiin an insêl a.

en: And the report of him went out straightway everywhere into all the region of Galilee round about.
hmr: Chun, Galili ram vêl po poah, ram tinah a chanchin ân thang nghâl tah a.

en: And straightway, when they were come out of the synagogue, they came into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna ina inthawk- a an suok chun, Simon le Andri inah Jakob leh Johan leh an lût a.

en: Now Simon’s wife’s mother lay sick of a fever; and straightway they tell him of her:
hmr: Chun, Simon tarpinu khaw- sikin a nah a, a lo zâl a; chuongchun, a umzie chu Isu an hril nghâl tah a;

en: and he came and took her by the hand, and raised her up; and the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
hmr: chun, ama chun, a kut a va chel a, a keitho tah a. Chuongchun, a khawsik chu a bo tah a, an rawng a bâwlpêk tah a.

en: And at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were sick, and them that were possessed with demons.
hmr: Chun, zântienga nisa tlâk hnung chun, damnaw po po le khaw- hri iman dâm a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a.

en: And all the city was gathered together at the door.
hmr: A khuo chun kawtkhâr bulah an hung inkhâwm tup el tah a.

en: And he healed many that were sick with divers diseases, and cast out many demons; and he suffered not the demons to speak, because they knew him.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi tamtak natna tinrêng invawihai chu a sukdam a, khawhri tamtak a hnawt suok bawk a; khawhrihai chun ama an hriet leiin an ṭawng a phal nawh a.

en: And in the morning, a great while before day, he rose up and went out, and departed into a desert place, and there prayed.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr inhmatakin, khawvar hma daiin a tho a, a suok a, hmun fienrielah a va feh a, chutaka chun a ṭawngṭai a.

en: And Simon and they that were with him followed after him;
hmr: Chun, Simon le a ruolhai chun an hnawtzui a;

en: and they found him, and say unto him, All are seeking thee.
hmr: ama an va hmu chun, a kuomah, “Mi po poin an zawng che i sawnnâwm ie,” an ta.

en: And he saith unto them, Let us go elsewhere into the next towns, that I may preach there also; for to this end came I forth.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Hmun danga khaw hnaiahai dâm chun fêng ei tiu, chuonga hai khawm chun thu ka hril theina dingin, hi lei taka hung ka ni nghâl a,” a ta.

en: And he went into their synagogues throughout all Galilee, preaching and casting out demons.
hmr: Chuongchun, thu hrila, khaw- hrihai khawm hnawt suok peiin Galili ram po poa an inkhâwmna inahai chun a lût pei a.

en: And there cometh to him a leper, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
hmr: Chun, a kuomah phâr a hung a, “I nuom chun i mi sukthieng thei,” a ta, a hmaah a dingṭhaṭhuon a, a ngên rak el a.

en: And being moved with compassion, he stretched forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I will; be thou made clean.
hmr: Ama chun a lo lunginsiet bêk bêk a; a hei ban a, a them a, “Ka nuom ie, sukthiengin lo um ta rawh,” a ta.

en: And straightway the leprosy departed from him, and he was made clean.
hmr: Chuongchun, kârloin ân phârna chu a bo nghâl el tah a, a hung inthieng tah a.

en: And he strictly charged him, and straightway sent him out,
hmr: Chun, ama chu hril lo dingin a tiem tlat a, ân fetir tah a;

en: and saith unto him, See thou say nothing to any man: but go show thyself to the priest, and offer for thy cleansing the things which Moses commanded, for a testimony unto them.
hmr: a kuomah, “Tu kuoma khawm iengkhawm va hril dêr naw raw kha; nisienlakhawm, thiempu kuomah vân entir la, an hriet fel theina dingin Mosie thil ruothai kha i înthienna dingin vân hlân rawh,” a ta.

en: But he went out, and began to publish it much, and to spread abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into a city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chu a suok a, tlânginsamin chu thu chu a phuong dar phut el tah a; chuongchun, Isu chu inphuongtakin khuo a lût thei ta nawh a; thlalêr hmunahai a um lem tah a; chun hmun tina mi a kuomah an hung hlak a.

en: And he arose from thence, and cometh into the borders of Judæa and beyond the Jordan: and multitudes come together unto him again; and, as he was wont, he taught them again.
hmr: Chun, a tho a, chutaka inthawk chu Judai ram le Jordan râlah a fe tah a; chun, mi- puihai chu a kuomah an hung inkhâwm nâwk a, chuongchun, a thaw dân ta ang rawpin a lo inchûktir nâwk a.

en: And there came unto him Pharisees, and asked him, Is it lawful for a man to put away his wife? trying him.
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai ṭhenkhat a kuomah an hung a, ama fiena dingin “Mîn a nuhmei a mâk a thieng am?” tiin an indawn a.

en: And he answered and said unto them, What did Moses command you?
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Mosien iengtin am thu a pêk cheu a?” tîn a dawn a.

en: And they said, Moses suffered to write a bill of divorcement, and to put her away.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Mosie chun inmâkna lekha inziekin mâk a phal hlak a nih,” an tih a.

en: But Jesus said unto them, For your hardness of heart he wrote you this commandment.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn an kuomah, “In lungril ngar leiin a nih in sawnnaw chu thu chu ân ziekpêk cheu chu.

en: But from the beginning of the creation, Male and female made he them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, leilung insîeng tîra inthawk chun, ‘Anni chu nuhmei le pasalin a siem a nih,’

en: For this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife;
hmr: ‘Chuleichun, pasalin a nu le pa mâksan a ta, a nuhmei chel a ta;

en: and the two shall become one flesh: so that they are no more two, but one flesh.
hmr: chuongchun, an pahni chun tisa pumkhat lo ni tâng an tih, chuongchun, pahni an ni ta nawh a, tisa pumkhat an lo ni ta lem a nih’.

en: What therefore God hath joined together, let not man put asunder.
hmr: Chuleiin, Pathienin a izawm ta hnung chu mihriemin ṭhe naw raw se,” a ta.

en: And in the house the disciples asked him again of this matter.
hmr: Chun, ina chun, a închûk- tirhaiin chuong thu chu an indawn nâwk a.

en: And he saith unto them, Whosoever shall put away his wife, and marry another, committeth adultery against her:
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Tû- khawm a nuhmei mah a, mi dang nei taphawt chun a nuhmei chu a retsan a nih;

en: and if she herself shall put away her husband, and marry another, she committeth adultery.
hmr: ama khawm chun a pasal inṭhepuia mi dang a nei chun a uire a ni bawk,” a ta.

en: And they were bringing unto him little children, that he should touch them: and the disciples rebuked them.
hmr: Chun, a ithem dingin naupang- tehai an hung ṭhuoi a; chun, inchûktirhai chun an lo hal a.

en: But when Jesus saw it, he was moved with indignation, and said unto them, Suffer the little children to come unto me; forbid them not: for to such belongeth the kingdom of God.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn chu chu a hmuin a lung a ni naw bêk bêk a, an kuoma chun, “Naupangtêhai ka kuomah inhungtir unla, khap naw ro; Pathien ram chu hieng ang mihai ta a ni sih a.

en: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu, tû- khawm Pathien ram chu naupang- têin a lâwm anga lâwm naw phawt chu a sûngah lût naw tawp an tih,” a ta.

en: And he took them in his arms, and blessed them, laying his hands upon them.
hmr: Chun, annirawi chu a hang kuoh a, an chungah kut innghatin mal a sâwmpêk tah a.

en: And as he was going forth into the way, there ran one to him, and kneeled to him, and asked him, Good Teacher, what shall I do that I may inherit eternal life?
hmr: Chun, fe dinga a suok laitakin mi pakhat a kuom tieng a hung tlân a, a hmaah a dingṭhaṭhuon a, a kuom- ah, “Inchûktirtu ṭha, kumkhuoa hringna ka nei theina dingin ieng am thâwng ka ta?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And Jesus said unto him, Why callest thou me good? none is good save one, even God.
hmr: Chun, Isu chun a kuomah, “Iengdinga ṭha i mi ti? Mi pakhat chau naw chu tukhawm ṭha an um nawh, chu chu Pathien a nih.

en: Thou knowest the commandments, Do not kill, Do not commit adultery, Do not steal, Do not bear false witness, Do not defraud, Honor thy father and mother.
hmr: Thupêkhai chu i hriet annâwm: ‘Tuol that naw, Uire naw, Inru naw, Hrietpuina inkhêl pe naw, Hlêm naw, I nu le pa chawimawi rawh,’ tihai hi,” a ta.

en: And he said unto him, Teacher, all these things have I observed from my youth.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, chuong thu po po chu naupang chîte ka ni laia inthawkin ka zâwm hlak,” a ta.

en: And Jesus looking upon him loved him, and said unto him, One thing thou lackest: go, sell whatsoever thou hast, and give to the poor, and thou shalt have treasure in heaven: and come, follow me.
hmr: Chun, Isûn ama chu a en a, a hmangai tah a, a kuomah, “Kawng khat i la bâk, fe la, i nei taphawt zawr la, pasiehai kuomah pe rawh, chuongchun, vânah ro nei i tih; chun, hung la mi hung zui rawh,” a ta.

en: But his countenance fell at the saying, and he went away sorrowful: for he was one that had great possessions.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong thu lei chun a hmêl chu a hung inthim khup el a, lungzîngtakin a fe hmang tah a, sum tamtak nei mi a ni sih a.

en: And Jesus looked round about, and saith unto his disciples, How hardly shall they that have riches enter into the kingdom of God!
hmr: Chun, Isûn a en vêl a, a închûk- tirhai kuoma chun, “Sumhauhai chu Pathien rama lût a vân tak âwm deh e,” a ta.

en: And the disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus answereth again, and saith unto them, Children, how hard is it for them that trust in riches to enter into the kingdom of God!
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chun, a thu hril chu mak an ti hle a, Isu ruok chun a dawn nâwk a, an kuomah, “Nauhai, sum ringhai ta ding chun Pathien rama lût a vân tak hlak deh aw;

en: It is easier for a camel to go through a needle’s eye, than for a rich man to enter into the kingdom of God.
hmr: Mihausa Pathien rama a lût nêkin sanghâwngsei ṭhim naa a lût thleng awl lem a tih,” a ta.

en: And they were astonished exceedingly, saying unto him, Then who can be saved?
hmr: Chun, anni chun mak an ti nasa bêk bêk a, a kuomah, “Anleh, tu am sandam ni thei an ti leh?” an ta.

en: Jesus looking upon them saith, With men it is impossible, but not with God: for all things are possible with God.
hmr: Isûn anni chu a en a, “Chu chu mihriem ta dingin thaw ruol a ni nawh a, Pathien ta ding ruok chun thaw ruol lo a ni nawh; Pathien ta dingin iengkim thaw thei a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: Peter began to say unto him, Lo, we have left all, and have followed thee.
hmr: Peterin a kuomah, “Ngai ta, keinîn iengkim mâksanin kan zui cheh a,” tiin a hang hril phut a.

en: Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, There is no man that hath left house, or brethren, or sisters, or mother, or father, or children, or lands, for my sake, and for the gospel’s sake,
hmr: Isu chun, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu, tûkhawm keia lei le Chanchin Ṭha leia in amanih, unaupahai amanih, farnuhai amanih, nu ama- nih, pa amanih, nauhai amanih, ram dâm khawm amanih fe san taphawt chu,

en: but he shall receive a hundredfold now in this time, houses, and brethren, and sisters, and mothers, and children, and lands, with persecutions; and in the world to come eternal life.
hmr: hi dam sûng ngei khawm hin, inhai, unaupahai, farnuhai, nuhai, nauhai, ramhai dâm a lêt zain, suknawmnatnahai leh, hmu naw ding tukhawm an um nawh, hun la hung tlung dinga chatuona hringna leh.

en: But many that are first shall be last; and the last first.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi tamtak a hmasataka umhai chu a nuhnung- takah la um an ta, a nuhnungtakhai khawm chu a hmasatakah la um an tih,” a ta.

en: And they were on the way, going up to Jerusalem; and Jesus was going before them: and they were amazed; and they that followed were afraid. And he took again the twelve, and began to tell them the things that were to happen unto him,
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema hang fe dingin lampuiah an um a; Isu chu a hmasah a. Anni chun mak an ti hleh a, a hung zuituhai chun an ṭih a. Chun, ama chun sâwm le pahnihai chu a tumin a ṭhuoi nâwk a,

en: saying, Behold, we go up to Jerusalem; and the Son of man shall be delivered unto the chief priests and the scribes; and they shall condemn him to death, and shall deliver him unto the Gentiles:
hmr: “Ngai ta u, Jerusalemah ei hang fe nâwk ding a ni hi; Mihriem Naupa hi thiempu lalhai le Dân inchûk- tirtuhai kuoma inmantirin a la um ding a nih. Anni chun thi dingin a chungah thu rêlthlûng an ta, Jentailhai kuomah pêng an tih.

en: and they shall mock him, and shall spit upon him, and shall scourge him, and shall kill him; and after three days he shall rise again.
hmr: Chun, nuizat siemnân hmang an ta, chil sâk khum an ta, vuong an ta, sukhlum an tih; chun, ni thum chenah thonâwk a tih,” tiin a chunga thil hung tlung dinghai chu an kuomah a hril tah a.

en: And there come near unto him James and John, the sons of Zebedee, saying unto him, Teacher, we would that thou shouldest do for us whatsoever we shall ask of thee.
hmr: Chun, Zebedai naupahai Jakob le Johan chun ama chu an hung hnai a, a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, i kuomah kan hni dinghai hi i mi thawpêk kan nuom,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, What would ye that I should do for you?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “In ta dingin ieng am thawpêk inla cheu in nuom a?” a ta.

en: And they said unto him, Grant unto us that we may sit, one on thy right hand, and one on thy left hand, in thy glory.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “I ropuinaa chun i changtieng pakhat, i vawitieng pakhat mîn ṭhungtir rawh aw?” an ta.

en: But Jesus said unto them, Ye know not what ye ask. Are ye able to drink the cup that I drink? or to be baptized with the baptism that I am baptized with?
hmr: Isu ruok chun an kuomah, “In hni chu in hriet naw a nih. Ka no dâwn ding chu in dâwn thei am a nih? Ka baptisma chang ding khawm chu in chang thei am a nih?” a ta.

en: And they said unto him, We are able. And Jesus said unto them, The cup that I drink ye shall drink; and with the baptism that I am baptized withal shall ye be baptized:
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Thei e,” an tih a. Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Ka no dâwn ding chu dâwn in ta, ka baptisma chang ding khawm chu chang vêng in tih;

en: but to sit on my right hand or on my left hand is not mine to give; but it is for them for whom it hath been prepared.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka chang- tienga manih ka vawitienga manih, ṭhung ding thu chu keia pêk ding a ni nawh a, an ibuotsaipêkhai ta ding ni lem a tih,” a ta.

en: And when the ten heard it, they began to be moved with indignation concerning James and John.
hmr: Chun, sâwmhai chun chu chu an lo hrietin Jakob le Johan chunga chun an lungninaw ta bêk bêk a.

en: And Jesus called them to him, and saith unto them, Ye know that they who are accounted to rule over the Gentiles lord it over them; and their great ones exercise authority over them.
hmr: Isu ruok chun annihai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Jentailhai chunga rorêltua an iruothai chu an chungah an inlal bêk bêk hlak a, an mi lienhai chun an chungah thu an nei nasa hle ti in hriet a.

en: But it is not so among you: but whosoever would become great among you, shall be your minister;
hmr: Nangni lai ruok chun chuong chu ni naw nih, tukhawm in laia mi lien ni nuom phawt chu in rawngbâwltuin a um lem ding a nih!

en: and whosoever would be first among you, shall be servant of all.
hmr: Tukhawm nangni laia a hmasatak ni nuom phawt chu mi po po rawng bâwltuin a um bawk ding a nih.

en: For the Son of man also came not to be ministered unto, but to minister, and to give his life a ransom for many.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa meu khawm rawngbâwlpêka um dinga hung a ni nawh a, mi tamtak intlanna dinga a hringna pe ding lema hung a ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And they come to Jericho: and as he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timæus, Bartimæus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the way side.
hmr: Chun, Jeriko an hung tlung a; chun, Isu Jerikoa inthawk chun a închûktirhai leh, mipui nasatak leh a suok laiin kutdaw mitdel, Timai naupa Bartimai chu lampui sîrah a lo ṭhung a.

en: And when he heard that it was Jesus the Nazarene, he began to cry out, and say, Jesus, thou son of David, have mercy on me.
hmr: Chuongchun, Nazareth Isu a nih ti a hriet phingin, “Isu David naupa, mi lunginsiet rawh,” tiin a khêk tah a.

en: And many rebuked him, that he should hold his peace: but he cried out the more a great deal, Thou son of David, have mercy on me.
hmr: Mi tamtakin to dingin an hal a; nisienlakhawm, ama chun, “David naupa, mi lunginsiet rawh,” tiin a khêk zuol det a.

en: And Jesus stood still, and said, Call ye him. And they call the blind man, saying unto him, Be of good cheer: rise, he calleth thee.
hmr: Isu chu a lo ngîr a, “Ama chu hung ko ta u,” a ta. Chun, mitdel chu an ko a, a kuomah, “Lungmuongtakin um rawh, a ko che,” an ta.

en: And he, casting away his garment, sprang up, and came to Jesus.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a puon a pei a, ân châwm tho a, Isu kuomah a feh a.

en: And Jesus answered him, and said, What wilt thou that I should do unto thee? And the blind man said unto him, Rabboni, that I may receive my sight.
hmr: Chun, Isûn ama chu a lo biek a, “I chungah ieng ang am ka thaw i nuom a?” a ta. Chun, mitdel chun a kuomah, “Rabboni, hmu thei ka nuom,” a ta.

en: And Jesus said unto him, Go thy way; thy faith hath made thee whole. And straightway he received his sight, and followed him in the way.
hmr: Chun, Isûn, “Fe ta rawh, i ring- na hi i dampui a nih,” a ta. Chuongchun, a hmu thei nghâl tah a, lampuia chun Isu a zui tah a.

en: And when they draw nigh unto Jerusalem, unto Bethphage and Bethany, at the mount of Olives, he sendeth two of his disciples,
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem an tlung tâwm a, Oliv tlânga Bethphage le Bethani khuo kâwl an tlungin, a închûktirhai laia mi pahni a tir a,

en: and saith unto them, Go your way into the village that is over against you: and straightway as ye enter into it, ye shall find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat; loose him, and bring him.
hmr: an kuomah, “In hma zâwn khuoa sawn fe unla; chun, in hei lût hlimin sabengtungte thlung, tukhawm la chuongna ngainaw va hmûng in ta; chu chu sût unla hung kei ro.

en: And if any one say unto you, Why do ye this? say ye, The Lord hath need of him; and straightway he will send him back hither.
hmr: Chun, tûkhawmin, ‘A kha ieng- ding am in tih a?’ an ti cheu chun, ‘Lalpain a mamaw a nih, ahin hung insietir nâwk vak a tih,’ ti ro,” a ta.

en: And they went away, and found a colt tied at the door without in the open street; and they loose him.
hmr: Chuongchun, an fe tah a, kawt- thlêra kawtkhâr puotienga sabeng- tungte inthlung an va hmuh a. Chun, chu chu an sût tah a.

en: And certain of them that stood there said unto them, What do ye, loosing the colt?
hmr: Chun, chutaka ngîr tuhai amani chun an kuomah, “Sabengtungte kha iengdinga in sût?” an ta.

en: And they said unto them even as Jesus had said: and they let them go.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, Isu hril ang tak khan an kuoma chun an hril a; chuongchun, an fe an phal tah a.

en: And they bring the colt unto Jesus, and cast on him their garments; and he sat upon him.
hmr: Chun, sabengtungte chu Isu kuomah an hung kei a, a chunga chun puonhai an phah a; chuongchun, a chungah a chuong tah a.

en: And many spread their garments upon the way; and others branches, which they had cut from the fields.
hmr: Chun, mi tamtakin lampuia chun an puon an phah a; mi dangin loa sâwlhna an va sât a, an pha bawk a.

en: And they that went before, and they that followed, cried, Hosanna; Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord:
hmr: Chun, a hma tienga fehai le a hnunga hung zuituhai chun, “Hosanna, Lalpa hminga hung chu inpâkin um raw se;

en: Blessed is the kingdom that cometh, the kingdom of our father David: Hosanna in the highest.
hmr: Ram hung tlung ding ei Pa David ram chu, inpâkin um raw se; A chunghnungtaka khin Hosanna,” tiin an khêk a.

en: And he entered into Jerusalem, into the temple; and when he had looked round about upon all things, it being now eventide, he went out unto Bethany with the twelve.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema Pathien biekina chun a va lût a; iengkim a en vêl zo chun; zântieng khawm a lo ni tah a, a suok a, sâwm le pahnihai leh Bethaniah an fe tah a.

en: And on the morrow, when they were come out from Bethany, he hungered.
hmr: Chun, azîng Bethania inthawka a suok hnungin a phîng a ṭâm tah a.

en: And seeing a fig tree afar off having leaves, he came, if haply he might find anything thereon: and when he came to it, he found nothing but leaves; for it was not the season of figs.
hmr: Chun, theichang kûng hna nei hlataka hin a hei hmuh a, “A ra ka hmu duoiin,” tiin a va feh a; a va tlung chun a hna chau naw chu iengkhawm a hmu nawh a; theichang ra pha a ni naw hrim a.

en: And he answered and said unto it, No man eat fruit from thee henceforward for ever. And his disciples heard it.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn thing chu a biek a, “Tuta hnung kumkhaw- tluongin i ra hrim hrim tukhawmin fa ta naw raw hai se,” a ta. A închûtirhai rawi chun chu chu an hriet a.

en: And they come to Jerusalem: and he entered into the temple, and began to cast out them that sold and them that bought in the temple, and overthrew the tables of the money-changers, and the seats of them that sold the doves;
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem chu a tlung a, Pathien biekinah a va lût a, biekina iengkhat zawrtuhai le ân chawtuhai chu a hnawt suok tah a. Tangka thlengtuhai dawkânhai le, vaṭhu zawrtuhai ṭhungphahai khawm chu a nam thlûk pêk bawk a.

en: and he would not suffer that any man should carry a vessel through the temple.
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina chun tukhawmin thuomhnaw an chawi thleng chu a phal ta bawk nawh a.

en: And he taught, and said unto them, Is it not written, My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations? but ye have made it a den of robbers.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun, “ ‘Ka in chu hnam tin ta dinga ṭawngṭaina in tîng an tih,’ ti ziek a ni naw am a nih? Nangni ruok chun suomhmanghai pûkin in siem lem hi,” tiin ân chûktir tah a.

en: And the chief priests and the scribes heard it, and sought how they might destroy him: for they feared him, for all the multitude was astonished at his teaching.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le Dân in- chûktirtuhai chun chu chu an hriet a, a sukbo theina ding zie an zawng a. Mipuihai po po chun a închûktirna chu mak an ti hle leiin ama an ṭi bawk si.

en: And every evening he went forth out of the city.
hmr: Chun, zântieng a hung ni chun, Isu le a inchûktirhai chu khawpuia inthawk chun an fe suok a.

en: And as they passed by in the morning, they saw the fig tree withered away from the roots.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâra an fe malam chun theichang kûng chu a zung chena thêm zo vawngin an hmu tah a.

en: And Peter calling to remembrance saith unto him, Rabbi, behold, the fig tree which thou cursedst is withered away.
hmr: Chuongchun, Peterin a hriet suok nâwk a, a kuomah, “Rabbi en ta, theichang kûng ṭawngsie în phur kha a lo thêm vawng tah,” a ta.

en: And Jesus answering saith unto them, Have faith in God.
hmr: Chun, Isu chun an kuomah, “Pathienah ringna nei ro.

en: Verily I say unto you, Whosoever shall say unto this mountain, Be thou taken up and cast into the sea; and shall not doubt in his heart, but shall believe that what he saith cometh to pass; he shall have it.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, tû- khawm hi tlâng kuoma hin, ‘Insawn la, tuisuorietah dehâwnin um rawh,’ tia a lungrila ringhla loa a iti chu tlung ngei a tih ti ring taphawtin an hril ang phawt chu hmûng an tih.

en: Therefore I say unto you, All things whatsoever ye pray and ask for, believe that ye receive them, and ye shall have them.
hmr: Chuleichun, ka ti cheu hi, iengkim ṭawngṭaia in hni taphawt chu, hmusain inngai unla, chuong- chun, hmûng in tih.

en: And whensoever ye stand praying, forgive, if ye have aught against any one; that your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.
hmr: Chun, ṭawngṭai dinga in ngîr pha po leh tu chunga khawm thupawi ieng am a nih in nei chun ngaidam ro; vâna in Pa khawmin in bawsietnahai chu a ngaidam theina ding cheu in.
[nisienlakhawm, in ngaidam naw chun, in Pa vâna mi khawmin ngaidam bîk naw ni cheu,]” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And they come again to Jerusalem: and as he was walking in the temple, there come to him the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders;
hmr: Chun, Jerusalem chu an tlung nâwk a; chun, Pathien biekina a lêng laiin thiempu lalhai, Dân inchûk- tirtuhai, upahai chu a kuomah an hung a,

en: and they said unto him, By what authority doest thou these things? or who gave thee this authority to do these things?
hmr: a kuoma chun, “Tu thuin am hieng hi i thaw a na? Hienghai hi thaw dingin tuin am thu a pêk cheh a?” an ta.

en: And Jesus said unto them, I will ask of you one question, and answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Kei khawmin thu bau khat indawn vêng ka ti cheu; mi dawn unla, chuongchun, tu thuin am hieng hi ka thaw hril ka ti cheu.

en: The baptism of John, was it from heaven, or from men? answer me.
hmr: Johan baptisma kha vâna mi thu amani, mihriem thu? mi dawn ro,” a ta.

en: And they reasoned with themselves, saying, If we shall say, From heaven; he will say, Why then did ye not believe him?
hmr: Chun, an inngaituoh a, “ ‘Vâna mi thu,’ ei ti chun, ‘Ieng dinga a thu in awi naw?’ a mi ti âwm sih a.

en: But should we say, From men—they feared the people: for all verily held John to be a prophet.
hmr: ‘Mihriem thu,’ ei ti el ding am a ni chu?” an ta. Nisienlakhawm, mipui chu an ṭih a, mi po poin Johan chu zâwlnei takin an ngai tâwl sih a.

en: And they answered Jesus and say, We know not. And Jesus saith unto them, Neither tell I you by what authority I do these things.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu chu an dawn a, “Kan hriet nawh,” an ta. Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Kei khawmin tu thuin am hieng hi ka thawh a, hril bîk naw ning cheuah,” a ta.

en: And he began to speak unto them in parables. A man planted a vineyard, and set a hedge about it, and digged a pit for the winepress, and built a tower, and let it out to husbandmen, and went into another country.
hmr: Chun, tekhithuin an kuomah a hril tah a, “Tuin amanih grêp huon a siem a, palin ân huon a, grêp sâwrna ding khur a cho a, in insâng a bâwl a, lo enkawltuhai kuomah thlo hlaw dingin a pêk a, ram dangah a fe tah a.

en: And at the season he sent to the husbandmen a servant, that he might receive from the husbandmen of the fruits of the vineyard.
hmr: Chun, a lo pha chun huona ra chu a chanâi lo enkawltuhai kuoma va la dingin lo enkawltuhai kuoma chun suok pakhat a tir a.

en: And they took him, and beat him, and sent him away empty.
hmr: Chun, chu mipa chu an lo man a, an vuok a, kut ruokin an infetir tah a.

en: And again he sent unto them another servant; and him they wounded in the head, and handled shamefully.
hmr: Chun, suok dang an kuoma chun a tir nâwk a; chu khawm chu a lu an lo sukpawp a, inzakumtakin an lo sawisah a.

en: And he sent another; and him they killed: and many others; beating some, and killing some.
hmr: Chun, suok dang a tir nâwk pei a, chu mipa chu an lo sukhlum a. Suok dang tamtak khawm aṭhen an lo vuok a, aṭhen an lo sukhlum a.

en: He had yet one, a beloved son: he sent him last unto them, saying, They will reverence my son.
hmr: Chun, pakhat, naupa dittak chu a la nei a, ‘Ka naupa hi chu inza êm naw ni hai am,’ tiin ama chu a nuhnungtakah an kuomah a tir a.

en: But those husbandmen said among themselves, This is the heir; come, let us kill him, and the inheritance shall be ours.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong lo en- kawltuhai chun, ‘Hi mipa hi rohluotu ding chu a nih; that ei tiu khai; chuongchun, a ro hluo dinghai hi ei ta a ni el ding a nih,’ an in tih a.

en: And they took him, and killed him, and cast him forth out of the vineyard.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu an lo man a, an sukhlum a, grêp huona inthawk chun an the suok tah a.

en: What therefore will the lord of the vineyard do? he will come and destroy the husbandmen, and will give the vineyard unto others.
hmr: Chuongchun, huon neitu chun iengtin am hung thâwng a ta? Lo enkawltuhai chu hung sukbo a ta, huon chu mi danghai pêng a tih.

en: Have ye not read even this scripture: The stone which the builders rejected, The same was made the head of the corner;
hmr: Hi Pathien Lekha Thu hi in tiem naw am a nih? ‘In bâwltuhai lung dit naw kha, Chu ngei chu a kia lung ṭhangkaitak a lo ni tah.

en: This was from the Lord, And it is marvellous in our eyes?
hmr: Chu chu Lalpa thaw a na, Ei mithmua hin a mak a nih,’ ti hi,” a ta.

en: And they sought to lay hold on him; and they feared the multitude; for they perceived that he spake the parable against them: and they left him, and went away.
hmr: Chun, ama chu man an tum tah a, nisienlakhawm, mipui an ṭi sih a, chu tekhithu chu anni demin a hril a nih ti an hriet sih a. Chuongchun, ama chu an mâksan a, an fe hmang tah a.

en: And they send unto him certain of the Pharisees and of the Herodians, that they might catch him in talk.
hmr: Chun, a thu hrila inthawka man dingin Pharisaihai le Herod pâwla tuhai amanih a kuomah an tir a.

en: And when they were come, they say unto him, Teacher, we know that thou art true, and carest not for any one; for thou regardest not the person of men, but of a truth teachest the way of God: Is it lawful to give tribute unto Cæsar, or not?
hmr: Chun, anni chu an hung tlung chun a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, mi indiktak i na, tukhawm pawisak chuong i nei nawh ti kan hriet a, tukhawm thlier bîk nei loin, theipatâwpin Pathien thu în chûktir hlak a. Kaisar kuoma sie chawi hi a thieng am a ni a thieng naw? kan pêk ding am a ni, kan pêk naw ding?” an ta.

en: Shall we give, or shall we not give? But he, knowing their hypocrisy, said unto them, Why make ye trial of me? bring me a denarius, that I may see it.
hmr: Ama ruok chun an vervêkziehai chu hre zingin, an kuomah, “Ieng- dinga in mi fie am a na? Duli hung la tu, lo en ka tih,” a ta.

en: And they brought it. And he saith unto them, Whose is this image and superscription? And they said unto him, Cæsar’s.
hmr: Chuongchun, an hung lâk a. Ama chun an kuomah, “Hi hi tu lim le tu hming am a na?” a ta. Anni chun, “Kaisar,” an ta.

en: And Jesus said unto them, Render unto Cæsar the things that are Cæsar’s, and unto God the things that are God’s. And they marvelled greatly at him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn an kuomah, “Kaisar thilhai chu Kaisar kuomah pe unla, Pathien thilhai chu Pathien kuomah pe ta unla,” a ta. Chuong- chun, mak an ti bêk bêk a.

en: And there come unto him Sadducees, who say that there is no resurrection; and they asked him, saying,
hmr: Chun, Saddukaihai, thonâwkna a um nawh tituhai chu a kuomah an hung a,

en: Teacher, Moses wrote unto us, If a man’s brother die, and leave a wife behind him, and leave no child, that his brother should take his wife, and raise up seed unto his brother.
hmr: a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, Mosie- in ‘Tûkhawm a unaupân nau nei loin a nuhmei thisan sienla, a unaupa chun a nuhmei chu hluong a ta, a unaupa ta dingin suon a thla pêk ding a nih,’ tiin a mi ziekpêk a nih.

en: There were seven brethren: and the first took a wife, and dying left no seed;
hmr: Awle, Sal sari hi an um a, a upatakin nuhmei a nei a, suon- mawngin a thih a.

en: and the second took her, and died, leaving no seed behind him; and the third likewise:
hmr: Chuongchun, a pahnina chun a nuhmei chu a hluoh a, suon mawngin a thi nâwk bawk a; pathumna khawmin chuong bawk chun.

en: and the seven left no seed. Last of all the woman also died.
hmr: Chuongchun, sal sarihai chu suon hrim hrim nei loin suon mawngin an thi vawng el tah a. A nuhnungtaka chun nuhmei khawm chu a thi tah a.

en: In the resurrection whose wife shall she be of them? for the seven had her to wife.
hmr: Thonâwk phaleh a tu tak nuhmei am nîng a ta? An pasari chun nuhmeiin an nei seng sih a,” tiin an indawn a.

en: Jesus said unto them, Is it not for this cause that ye err, that ye know not the scriptures, nor the power of God?
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Hi lei hin a nih in ngai suol rawp hlak, Pathien Lekha Thu le Pathien thil thaw theizie in hriet naw leiin.

en: For when they shall rise from the dead, they neither marry, nor are given in marriage; but are as angels in heaven.
hmr: Mithi laia an tho nâwk hnungin nuhmei pasal innei ta naw nihai a, vâna vântirkohai ang an ni lem ta ding a nih.

en: But as touching the dead, that they are raised; have ye not read in the book of Moses, in the place concerning the Bush, how God spake unto him, saying, I am the God of Abraham, and the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?
hmr: Chun, mithihai keithoa an um ding thu chu, Mosie lekhabua chîmbuk thua khan Pathienin ‘Kei Abraham Pathien, Isak Pathien, Jakob Pathien ka nih,’ tia a biekzie kha in tiem naw am a nih?

en: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living: ye do greatly err.
hmr: Ama chu mithi Pathien a ni nawh a, mi hring Pathien a ni lem; in ngai suol nasa hle a nih,” a ta.

en: And one of the scribes came, and heard them questioning together, and knowing that he had answered them well, asked him, What commandment is the first of all?
hmr: Chun, Dân inchûktirtuhai laia mi pakhat a hung a, an insêl chu a lo ngai zing a, Isûn annirawi chu ṭhatakin a dawn ti a hriet a, a kuomah, “Thupêk po po lai ieng him a ropui tak a?” tîn ân dawn a.

en: Jesus answered, The first is, Hear, O Israel; The Lord our God, the Lord is one:
hmr: Isun “A ropui tak chu hi hi a nih, ‘Israelhai, ngai ta u, Lalpa ei Pathien chu Lalpa pakhat chau a nih,

en: and thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength.
hmr: Lalpa i Pathien chu i lungvar po poin, i thlarau po poin, i lungril po poin, i hrâtna po poin i hmangai ding a nih,’ ti hi.

en: The second is this, Thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself. There is none other commandment greater than these.
hmr: A dawttu chu hi hi a nih, ‘Nang le nang în hmangai angin i vênghai khawm i hmangai ding a nih,’ ti hi. Hieng nêka thupêk ropui lem hrim hrim hi a um nawh,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And the scribe said unto him, Of a truth, Teacher, thou hast well said that he is one; and there is none other but he:
hmr: Chun, Dân inchûktirtu chun a kuomah, “A ni luo ie, inchûktirtu, Ama chu pakhat chau a na, ama naw chu tukhawm dang an um nawh,

en: and to love him with all the heart, and with all the understanding, and with all the strength, and to love his neighbor as himself, is much more than all whole burnt-offerings and sacrifices.
hmr: ama chu lungril po poa, hrietna po poa, hrâtna po poa hmangai a, mâni inhmangai anga vênghai hmangai chu pumrawhmang ser pêk po po le inthawina po po nêkin a ṭha lem bêk bêk ti hi i hril dik ngawt el,” a ta.

en: And when Jesus saw that he answered discreetly, he said unto him, Thou art not far from the kingdom of God. And no man after that durst ask him any question.
hmr: Chun, vartakin a dawn ti Isûn a hrietin a kuomah, “Pathien ram i hlat naw hi” a ta. Chu hnunga chun tukhawmin thu hrim hrim an indawn ngam nawh a.

en: And Jesus answered and said, as he taught in the temple, How say the scribes that the Christ is the son of David?
hmr: Chun, Isûn Pathien biekina ân chûktir laiin an kuomah, “Krista chu David naupa a nih ti Dân inchûk- tirtuhaiin iengti ziea hril hlak am an nih a?

en: David himself said in the Holy Spirit, The Lord said unto my Lord, Sit thou on my right hand, Till I make thine enemies the footstool of thy feet.
hmr: David ngeiin, Thlarau Inthieng- in, ‘Lalpa chun ka Lalpa kuomah, Ka changtieng ṭhung rawh, I hmêlmahai i kepha hnuoia ka sie hmakhat chu,’ a tih a,

en: David himself calleth him Lord; and whence is he his son? And the common people heard him gladly.
hmr: “David ngei chun ama chu, ‘Lalpa,’ a ti sih a, khâwlai am a naupa ni hlak a ta?” tîn a dawn a. Chun, vântlânghai chun a thu chu lâwm- takin an ngai a.

en: And in his teaching he said, Beware of the scribes, who desire to walk in long robes, and to have salutations in the marketplaces,
hmr: Chun, a închûktirnaa chun, “Dân inchûktirtuhai lai hin fimkhur ro, anni chun zakuo fuol hâka lêng an nuom hlak a, dâwr hmuna chibai bûk dâm,

en: and chief seats in the synagogues, and chief places at feasts:
hmr: inkhâwmna ina ṭhungpha ṭhatak dâm, thlaithlêng awtnaa dâm hmun ṭhatak an ngiet hlak a.

en: they that devour widows’ houses, and for a pretence make long prayers; these shall receive greater condemnation.
hmr: Hmeithai sum an fâk a, vân- tlâng hlêmna dingin sâwt tak tak an ṭawngṭai hlak a, chuonghai chun thiemnaw chang nasa zuol an tih,” a ta.

en: And he sat down over against the treasury, and beheld how the multitude cast money into the treasury: and many that were rich cast in much.
hmr: Chun, thawlâwm bâwm zâwna chun a ṭhung a, thawlâwm bâwma mipuihai tangka thlâkzie chu a en a, mihausa tamtakin tamtak an thlâk a.

en: And there came a poor widow, and she cast in two mites, which make a farthing.
hmr: Chun, hmeithai pasetak a hung a, dâr tangka dere pahni a thlâk a, (chu chu pawisa khat hu a nih.)

en: And he called unto him his disciples, and said unto them, Verily I say unto you, This poor widow cast in more than all they that are casting into the treasury:
hmr: Isu chun a închûktirhai chu a ko a, an kuomah, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, thawlâwm bâwma thlâktu po po hai nêkin hi hmeithai pasetak hin a thlâk tam lem.

en: for they all did cast in of their superfluity; but she of her want did cast in all that she had, even all her living.
hmr: Hienghai po po hin an nei chuongliem an thlâk a na, ama ruok hin chu a ditlai tak, a neisun tak, a întodelna ding po chu a thlâk a nih,” a ta.

en: And as he went forth out of the temple, one of his disciples saith unto him, Teacher, behold, what manner of stones and what manner of buildings!
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina in- thawka a fe suok lai chun, a închûktirhai laia mi pakhatin a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, en ta, a lung le inhai hi a ropui hle a nih,” a ta.

en: And Jesus said unto him, Seest thou these great buildings? there shall not be left here one stone upon another, which shall not be thrown down.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Hieng in nasatak hi in hmu maw? Sukchim loa lung inthuo hrim hrim hitaka hin um naw ni,” a ta.

en: And as he sat on the mount of Olives over against the temple, Peter and James and John and Andrew asked him privately,
hmr: Chun, Oliv tlâng Pathien biekin zâwna a ṭhung laiin Peter hai, Jakob hai, Johan hai, Andri hai chun a kuomah, “Chuong chu iengtik am hung um a ta?

en: Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign when these things are all about to be accomplished?
hmr: Chuonghai po po a hung tlung ding pha inchikna ieng am um a ta? mi hril rawh,” tîn inrûkin an indawn a.

en: And Jesus began to say unto them, Take heed that no man lead you astray.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Tu- khawmin an hlêm nawna ding cheuin fimkhur ro.

en: Many shall come in my name, saying, I am he; and shall lead many astray.
hmr: Mi tamtakin, ‘Krista chu ka nih,’ tîn keia hming sâlin hung an ta, mi tamtak hlêm an tih.

en: And when ye shall hear of wars and rumors of wars, be not troubled: these things must needs come to pass; but the end is not yet.
hmr: Chun, indo thu le indo thuthang dâm in hriet pha leh lunginzing naw ro; chuongchu hung tlung ding hrim a nih; nisienlakhawm, tâwpna chu la ni hri naw ni.

en: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; there shall be earthquakes in divers places; there shall be famines: these things are the beginning of travail.
hmr: Hnam dang le hnam dang indo an ta; ram tum le ram tum indo an ta; hmun dang dangah simkhawleihai inhnîng a ta, ṭâmhai tlâng a ta. Chuong chu nauhase phut ang hi nîng a tih.

en: But take ye heed to yourselves: for they shall deliver you up to councils; and in synagogues shall ye be beaten; and before governors and kings shall ye stand for my sake, for a testimony unto them.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, fimkhur ro, rorêltuhai an inmantir ding cheu a nih; inkhâwmna inhaiah vuong an ti cheu a, keia leiin hotuhai le lalhai hmaah anni inhriettirna dingin la ngîr bawk in tih.

en: And the gospel must first be preached unto all the nations.
hmr: Chun, Chanchin Ṭha hi hnam po po laia hril hmasak ding a nih.

en: And when they lead you to judgment, and deliver you up, be not anxious beforehand what ye shall speak: but whatsoever shall be given you in that hour, that speak ye; for it is not ye that speak, but the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chun, an ṭhuoi cheua an inmantir phâ cheu chun, ‘Ieng am ka hril ding a na?’ tiin ngaituo lâwk naw ro, a hun taka inhriettira in um chu, chu ngei chu hril lem ro; a hriltu chu nangni in ni âwm si nawh a. Thlarau Inthieng ni lem a tih.

en: And brother shall deliver up brother to death, and the father his child; and children shall rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.
hmr: Chun, sukhlum dingin unau khawm inmantir an ta, pa khawmin a nau inmantir bawk a ta, nauhai khawmin an nu le pahai do an ta, insukhlumtir bawk an tih.

en: And ye shall be hated of all men for my name’s sake: but he that endureth to the end, the same shall be saved.
hmr: Ka hming leiin mi po po theida nîng in ta; nisienlakhawm, a tâwp chena tuor pei chu, chu ngei chu sandamin um a tih.

en: But when ye see the abomination of desolation standing where he ought not (let him that readeth understand), then let them that are in Judæa flee unto the mountains:
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, sukrêmtu tir- dakum chu a ngîr nawna dinga ngîr in hmu phâleh, (a tiem taphawt chun a umzie hre raw se); chu phâ chun Judai rama umhai chu tlânga dâm tlân hmang raw se;

en: and let him that is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house:
hmr: chun in chunga um chu ṭum naw raw se, a in sûnga thuomhnaw inchu ding khawmin lût naw raw se;

en: and let him that is in the field not return back to take his cloak.
hmr: Chun, loa um chu a puon inchu dingin kîr nâwk naw raw se.

en: But woe unto them that are with child and to them that give suck in those days!
hmr: Chuong nia chun inrai le naute pawm laihai chu an chung rik a tih.

en: And pray ye that it be not in the winter.
hmr: Chun, chuong chu phalbi laia a tlung nawna dingin ṭawngṭai ro.

en: For those days shall be tribulation, such as there hath not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never shall be.
hmr: Chuong ni chu rimsik ni a ni ding a ni sih a; chuong anga nasa hrim hrim chu Pathien isiem leilung insieng tîra inthawk tu chen hin a la um ngai nawh a, iengtika khawm hung um nâwk ta naw bawk a tih.

en: And except the Lord had shortened the days, no flesh would have been saved; but for the elect’s sake, whom he chose, he shortened the days.
hmr: Chun, Lalpân chuong nihai chu suktawi naw sien chu mihriem hrim hrim damin suok naw ni hai; nisienlakhawm, mi thlang a iruothai leiin nihai chu a suktawi a.

en: And then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is the Christ; or, Lo, there; believe it not:
hmr: “Chun, chu phâle chun, tû- khawmin in kuomah, ‘En ta, Krista chu hiva hin a um,’ amanih, ‘En ta, sawva saw,’ amanih an ti chun awi naw ro.

en: for there shall arise false Christs and false prophets, and shall show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, the elect.
hmr: Krista tehlêm le zâwlnei te- hlêmhai an hung suok ding a ni sih a; chuonghai chun inchikna le thilmak tak tak thâwng an tih, thei hai sienla, thlanghai rau khawm an hlêm theina dingin.

en: But take ye heed: behold, I have told you all things beforehand.
hmr: Nangni ruok chu fimkhur ro, ngai ta u, iengkim ka hril lâwk ta cheu hi.

en: But in those days, after that tribulation, the sun shall be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light,
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chuong nia chuong rimsikna hnunga chun nisa sukthimin um a ta, thla var ta naw nih a,

en: and the stars shall be falling from heaven, and the powers that are in the heavens shall be shaken.
hmr: vâna inthawkin arasihai hung tlâng a ta, vâna thilthawtheina umhai chu sukhnîngin um a tih.

en: And then shall they see the Son of man coming in clouds with great power and glory.
hmr: Chu phâ le chun Mihriem Naupa hi thilthawtheina nasatak leh sûm laia hung hmûng an tih.

en: And then shall he send forth the angels, and shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from the uttermost part of the earth to the uttermost part of heaven.
hmr: Chun, vântirko chu tir suok a ta, a thlanghai chu kâwl kil lia inthawkin, hnuoi tâwpa inthawka vân tawp chenin lâwr khawm a tih.

en: Now from the fig tree learn her parable: when her branch is now become tender, and putteth forth its leaves, ye know that the summer is nigh;
hmr: “Chuongchun, theichang kûnga hin chu tekhithu chu inchûk ro; a kau a hung indâwn a, a hna a hung inder chun nipui a ni ding a ni tah ti in hriet hlak.

en: even so ye also, when ye see these things coming to pass, know ye that he is nigh, even at the doors.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin nangni khawmin, chuong chu a hung tlung in hmu phâ chun ama chu a hung hnai tah a, kawtkhâr bul ngeiah a um tah ti hre ro.

en: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass away, until all these things be accomplished.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, chuong po po chu a tlung hmakhat chu, tulaia ruoltharhai hi bo naw nihai.

en: Heaven and earth shall pass away: but my words shall not pass away.
hmr: Hnuoi le vân bo a ta, ka thu ruok chu bo naw ni.

en: But of that day or that hour knoweth no one, not even the angels in heaven, neither the Son, but the Father.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, chu ni le a dâr thu chu Pa chau naw chun tu- khawmin, vâna vântirkohai khawmin, Naupa khawmin, an hriet nawh.

en: Take ye heed, watch and pray: for ye know not when the time is.
hmr: Fimkhur unla, inring zinga umin ṭawngṭai ro, a hun chu in hriet si nawh a.

en: It is as when a man, sojourning in another country, having left his house, and given authority to his servants, to each one his work, commanded also the porter to watch.
hmr: Mîn a in mâksana, a suokhai chu thu inneitira, an sin thaw ding pe seng a, kawtkhâr vêngtu khawm chu inring zinga um ding thu a pêk zet a, ram hlataka inzin ta dai ang a nih.

en: Watch therefore: for ye know not when the lord of the house cometh, whether at even, or at midnight, or at cockcrowing, or in the morning;
hmr: Chuongchun, inring zingin um ro, in neitupa hung ding phâ chu zântienga manih, zâna manih, ârkhuona manih, zîngkara mani ding in hriet si nawh a;

en: lest coming suddenly he find you sleeping.
hmr: chuong naw chun hung phut a ta, inin hung hmu hlau rawi a ti cheu.

en: And what I say unto you I say unto all, Watch.
hmr: Chun, in kuoma ka hril hi mi po po kuoma hril ka nih, inring zingin um ro,” a ti tah a.

en: Now after two days was the feast of the passover and the unleavened bread: and the chief priests and the scribes sought how they might take him with subtlety, and kill him:
hmr: Chun, ni hni hnung chun Fekân Ruoiṭhe le Chawl- ṭhanglo bei Ruoiṭhe a um ding a na; Thiempu lalhai le Dân inchûk- tirtuhai chun ama chu zâwra, mana sukhlum theina dingzie an zawng an zawng a.

en: for they said, Not during the feast, lest haply there shall be a tumult of the people.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, “Ruoiṭhe sûng chu ni naw sienla, chuong naw chun vântlâng lai buoina hung um hlau rawi a tih,” an ta.

en: And while he was in Bethany in the house of Simon the leper, as he sat at meat, there came a woman having an alabaster cruse of ointment of pure nard very costly; and she brake the cruse, and poured it over his head.
hmr: Chun, Bethania phâr Simon ina bu a fâk a, a um laiin nuhmei pakhat alabastar bûra spiknard hriek riminhnik totak chawiin a hung a, a bûr chu a sukkawi a, a lu a buok khum a.

en: But there were some that had indignation among themselves, saying, To what purpose hath this waste of the ointment been made?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a ṭhen chu an lung a sen tâwla, “Iengdinga hriek rim inhnik hi a sukhmangthai mei mei am a na?

en: For this ointment might have been sold for above three hundred shillings, and given to the poor. And they murmured against her.
hmr: Hi hriek hi duli zathum nêka tama zawr a, pasiehai kuoma pêk thei a ni sih a,” an ta. Chuongchun, a chunga chun an chier tah a.

en: But Jesus said, Let her alone; why trouble ye her? she hath wrought a good work on me.
hmr: Isu ruok chun, an kuomah, “To san ro, iengdinga ama in sukbuoi am a na? ka chunga hin thil mawi tak a thaw a nih.

en: For ye have the poor always with you, and whensoever ye will ye can do them good: but me ye have not always.
hmr: Pasiehai chu kumkhuoa in kuoma um an na, in nuom phâ phâ anni chu in lunginsiet thei annâwm, kei ruok chu kumkhuoa in kuoma um ding ka ni nawh hi.

en: She hath done what she could; she hath anointed my body beforehand for the burying.
hmr: A thaw thei ang tâwk a thaw a nih; ka taksa hi phûm dingin a lo nâl lâwk a ni hi.

en: And verily I say unto you, Wheresoever the gospel shall be preached throughout the whole world, that also which this woman hath done shall be spoken of for a memorial of her.
hmr: Chuongchun, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, khawvêl po poah, khâwlai khawm Chanchin Ṭha an hrilna taphawta chun hi nuhmei thil thaw hi ama hriet zingna dingin hril sa pei an tih,” a ta.

en: And Judas Iscariot, he that was one of the twelve, went away unto the chief priests, that he might deliver him unto them.
hmr: Chun, Juda Iskariot, sâwm le pahni laia mi pakhat khan, Isu chu an kuoma ân mantir theina dingin thiempu lalhai kuomah a va feh a.

en: And they, when they heard it, were glad, and promised to give him money. And he sought how he might conveniently deliver him unto them.
hmr: Chun, anni chun an hriet phingleh an lâwm hle a, a kuoma tangka pêk an tiem a, chuongchun, a înmantir dingzie remchâng a zawng tah a.

en: And on the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the passover, his disciples say unto him, Where wilt thou that we go and make ready that thou mayest eat the passover?
hmr: Chun, Chawlṭhanglo bei Ruoi- ṭhe ni hmasatak Fekan Ruoiṭhena berâmte an thatna hlak nia chun a închûktirhaiin a kuomah, “Fekân Ruoi bu i fâk theina dingin khâwlai am va siem inlang i nuom a?” an ta.

en: And he sendeth two of his disciples, and saith unto them, Go into the city, and there shall meet you a man bearing a pitcher of water: follow him;
hmr: Chuongchun, a închûktirhai laia mi pahni a tir a, an kuomah, “Khawpuiah va lût unla, pasal bêla tui putin intuokpui a ti cheu a, ama chu zui lût ro.

en: and wheresoever he shall enter in, say to the master of the house, The Teacher saith, Where is my guest-chamber, where I shall eat the passover with my disciples?
hmr: Chun, a lûtna naa chun, chu in neitupa kuoma chun, ‘Inchûktirtu chun, ka închûktirhai le Fekân Ruoi bu kan fâkna ding ka mikhuol pindan chu khâwlai am a na? a tih’ ti unla.

en: And he will himself show you a large upper room furnished and ready: and there make ready for us.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama ngei chun pindan chunghnung lientak, thuom- hnaw umsa, inrêlsa diem, inentir a ti cheu a, chu hmuna chun ei ta dingin va siem ro,” a ta.

en: And the disciples went forth, and came into the city, and found as he had said unto them: and they made ready the passover.
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu an feh a, khawpuia chun an va lût a; an kuoma a hril ang khan an va hmuh a, chun, Fekân Ruoi bu chu an siem tah a.

en: And when it was evening he cometh with the twelve.
hmr: Chun, zântieng a hung ni chun, ama chu sâwm le pahnihai le chun an va fe tah a.

en: And as they sat and were eating, Jesus said, Verily I say unto you, One of you shall betray me, even he that eateth with me.
hmr: Chun, an awt a, an fâk laiin Isûn, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, nangni laia mi pakhat ka kuoma fa ve ngei hin mîn mantir a tih,” a ta.

en: They began to be sorrowful, and to say unto him one by one, Is it I?
hmr: Chun, an lungngai ta hle a, pakhat khatin a kuomah, “Kei am ka nih?” an ti seng a.

en: And he said unto them, It is one of the twelve, he that dippeth with me in the dish.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Sâwm le pahni laia mi pakhat thlênga a mîn chiepuitu hi a nih.

en: For the Son of man goeth, even as it is written of him: but woe unto that man through whom the Son of man is betrayed! good were it for that man if he had not been born.
hmr: Mihriem Naupa hi a chanchin an ziek ang tak khan a fe ding a nih; nisienlakhawm, Mihriem Naupa inmantirtu ding mihriem chung chu a rik; chu mipa chu lo insieng naw sienla a ta dingin ṭha lem a tih,” a ta.

en: And as they were eating, he took bread, and when he had blessed, he brake it, and gave to them, and said, Take ye: this is my body.
hmr: Chun, an fâk laiin Isûn bei a lâk a, mal a sâwm zoin a khawi a, an kuomah a pêk a, “La ro, hi hi ka taksa a nih,” a ta.

en: And he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave to them: and they all drank of it.
hmr: Chun, no a lâk a, lâwmthu a hril zoin anni a pêk a, chuongchun, an rêngin an dâwn ta seng a.

en: And he said unto them, This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, an kuomah, “Hi hi ka thisen, mi tamtak ta dinga suok ding thu thlungna chu a nih.

en: Verily I say unto you, I shall no more drink of the fruit of the vine, until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, Pathien rama a thar ka dâwn ni a tlung hmâkhat chu, grêp hrui raa hi dâwn nâwk ta naw ning,” a ta.

en: And when they had sung a hymn, they went out unto the mount of Olives.
hmr: Chuongchun, hla an sak zo chun an fe suok a, Oliv tlânga chun an fe tah a.

en: And Jesus saith unto them, All ye shall be offended: for it is written, I will smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered abroad.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “In rêngin lungniloin la um vawng in tih, ‘Berâmpu vuong ka ta, berâmhai chu indar an tih,’ ti ziek a ni sih a.

en: Howbeit, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka thonâwk hnungin Galili ramah in hmaah fêng ka tih,” a ta.

en: But Peter said unto him, Although all shall be offended, yet will not I.
hmr: Peter ruok chun a kuomah, “An rêngin lungniloin um hai sienla khawm, kei chu um naw ning,” a ta.

en: And Jesus saith unto him, Verily I say unto thee, that thou to-day, even this night, before the cock crow twice, shalt deny me thrice.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn a kuom- ah, “Titakzetin ka hril che, vawisûn, vawizân le le hin âr vawi hni a khuong hmâin nangin vawi thum mîn phat i tih,” a ta.

en: But he spake exceeding vehemently, If I must die with thee, I will not deny thee. And in like manner also said they all.
hmr: Ama ruok chun nasatakin, “I thinaa chun thi ve ding ni lang khawm, inphat naw tawp ka ti che,” a ta. Chuongchun, ama ang chun an ti ta seng a.

en: And they come unto a place which was named Gethsemane: and he saith unto his disciples, Sit ye here, while I pray.
hmr: Chun, Gethsemane an ti hmun chu an tlung a; chuongchun, ama chun a închûktirhai kuomah, “Ka ṭawngṭai sûng po hitaka hin lo ṭhung ro,” a ta.

en: And he taketh with him Peter and James and John, and began to be greatly amazed, and sore troubled.
hmr: Chun, Peter hai, Jakob hai, Johan hai chu a ṭhuoi a; nasatakin a thlaphângin a lunginzing ta bêk bêk a.

en: And he saith unto them, My soul is exceeding sorrowful even unto death: abide ye here, and watch.
hmr: Chuongchun, an kuomah, “Ka lungril a lungngai bêk bêk a, thipui khawp rau a nih, hitaka hin um unla inring zing ro,” a ta.

en: And he went forward a little, and fell on the ground, and prayed that, if it were possible, the hour might pass away from him.
hmr: Chun, hmatieng chun a va fe hlek a, hnuoia chun a bawkkhup a, thaw thei ni sien chu chu hun chun ama khêl dingin a ṭawngṭai a.

en: And he said, Abba, Father, all things are possible unto thee; remove this cup from me: howbeit not what I will, but what thou wilt.
hmr: “Abba, (Pa,) tinrêng i thaw thei a, hi no hi ka kuoma inthawkin la sawn rawh; nisienlakhawm, keia thu ni loin, nangma thu thu ni lem raw se,” a ta.

en: And he cometh, and findeth them sleeping, and saith unto Peter, Simon, sleepest thou? couldest thou not watch one hour?
hmr: Chun, a hung a, annirawi chu inin a hung hmuh a; chuongchun, Peter kuomah, “Simon, i in a ni maw? Dâr kâr khat khawm inring zingin i um thei naw maw?

en: Watch and pray, that ye enter not into temptation: the spirit indeed is willing, but the flesh is weak.
hmr: Thlêmnaa in lût nawna dingin inring zingin ṭawngṭai ro. Thlarau chun chu a pei a, tisa ruok chu a hrât naw a nih,” a ta.

en: And again he went away, and prayed, saying the same words.
hmr: Chun, a va fe nâwk a, a thu hril ngai bawk chu hrilin a ṭawngṭai nâwk a.

en: And again he came, and found them sleeping, for their eyes were very heavy; and they knew not what to answer him.
hmr: Chun, a hung kîr nâwk chun annirawi chu inin a hung hmu nâwk a, an îmu a suok hle sih a, ama dawn ngaina an hriet nawh a.

en: And he cometh the third time, and saith unto them, Sleep on now, and take your rest: it is enough; the hour is come; behold, the Son of man is betrayed into the hands of sinners.
hmr: Chun, a hung a, a vawi thumnaa chun an kuomah, “Tuhin chu in unla châwl ta ro, a hun tâwk tah! a hun chu a tlung a ni ta hi! Ngai ta u, Mihriem Naupa hi mi suolhai kutah an inmantir ding a ni hi.

en: Arise, let us be going: behold, he that betrayeth me is at hand.
hmr: Tho unla fêng ei tiu, en ta u, a mîn mantirtu ding chu a hung hnai ta hi,” a ta.

en: And straightway, while he yet spake, cometh Judas, one of the twelve, and with him a multitude with swords and staves, from the chief priests and the scribes and the elders.
hmr: Chun, a la hril lai zingin, Juda, sâwm le pahnihai laia mi pakhat chu a hung tlung nghâl el tah a, ama ruol chun thiempu lalhai le Dân in- chûktirtuhai le upahai kuoma inthawk, mipui chu, kâwlhnâm le hembâwk dâm chawiin an hung tlung bawk a.

en: Now he that betrayed him had given them a token, saying, Whomsoever I shall kiss, that is he; take him, and lead him away safely.
hmr: Chun, a înmantirtu ding chun, “Ka ifâwp chu ama nîng a ta, man unla feltakin ṭhuoi hmang el ro,” tîn a hmân inchikna dâm a lo hril vawng ta sa a na.

en: And when he was come, straightway he came to him, and saith, Rabbi; and kissed him.
hmr: Chuongchun, a tlung phingleh ama a va pan nghâl tah a, “Rabbi,” tiin a fâwp ngâwi ngâwi a.

en: And they laid hands on him, and took him.
hmr: Chun, ama chu an chel a, an man tah a.

en: But a certain one of them that stood by drew his sword, and smote the servant of the high priest, and struck off his ear.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma ngirhai laia tuin amanih a kâwlhnâm a phawi a. Thiempu Laltak suokpa chu a sât a, a nakâwr a sât thlâkpêk a.

en: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Are ye come out, as against a robber, with swords and staves to seize me?
hmr: Chun, Isûn anni chu a biek a, an kuomah, “Kâwlhnâmhai, hembâwk- hai chawiin suomhmang man ding ang elin, mi man dingin in hung a ni maw?

en: I was daily with you in the temple teaching, and ye took me not: but this is done that the scriptures might be fulfilled.
hmr: Pathien biekinah ni tin inchûktirin ka um hlak a, in mi man si nawh a. Nisienlakhawm, Pathien Lekha Thu chu a hung tlung theina ding a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And they all left him, and fled.
hmr: Chun, an rêngin ama chu an zâmsan a, an tlân hmang vawng tah a.

en: And a certain young man followed with him, having a linen cloth cast about him, over his naked body: and they lay hold on him;
hmr: Chun, tlangvâl tu amanih puon zai inhmi chaua inbelin, ama chu a zui a; chuongchun, ama chu an lo man a.

en: but he left the linen cloth, and fled naked.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a puon zai inhmi chu a mâksan a, ruokin a tlân hmang tah a.

en: And they led Jesus away to the high priest: and there come together with him all the chief priests and the elders and the scribes.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu Thiempu Laltak kuomah an ṭhuoi a; ama ruol chun thiempu lalhai, upahai, Dân in- chûktirtuhai po po an hung khâwm a.

en: And Peter had followed him afar off, even within, into the court of the high priest; and he was sitting with the officers, and warming himself in the light of the fire.
hmr: Chun, Peterin hlataka hin ama chu, Thiempu Laltak in in huonna sûng tuol chen chun a zui a; chuongchun, manmihai lai chun mei lum awiin a ṭhung veh a.

en: Now the chief priests and the whole council sought witness against Jesus to put him to death; and found it not.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu chu an sukhlum theina dingin thiempu lalhai le rorêltuhai po po chun ama hêkna an zawng a; an hmu si nawh a.

en: For many bare false witness against him, and their witness agreed not together.
hmr: Mi tamtakin khêlin an hêk a; nisienlakhawm, an hêkna thuhai chu ân hmu thei si nawh a.

en: And there stood up certain, and bare false witness against him, saying,
hmr: Chun, tuhai amanih an ngîr a, khêlin an hêk a,

en: We heard him say, I will destroy this temple that is made with hands, and in three days I will build another made without hands.
hmr: “Hi mipa hin, ‘Hi Pathien biekin kuta bâwl hi ṭhiek ka ta, ni thum kâr chauin biekin dang, kuta bâwl naw mi bâwl ka tih,’ a ti kan hriet,” an ta.

en: And not even so did their witness agree together.
hmr: Chuong khawm chun an hêkna thu ân hmu thei chuong nawh a.

en: And the high priest stood up in the midst, and asked Jesus, saying, Answerest thou nothing? what is it which these witness against thee?
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak chu a ngîr suok a, Isu kuomah, “Ieng- khawmin i dawn naw maw? Hienghaiin an hêkna che hi ieng tizie am a na?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: But he held his peace, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, and saith unto him, Art thou the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?
hmr: Ama ruok chu a to zing a, iengkhawmin a dawn nawh a. Thiempu Laltak chun a kuomah, “Krista, Inpâk tlâk Naupa chu i ni maw?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And Jesus said, I am: and ye shall see the Son of man sitting at the right hand of Power, and coming with the clouds of heaven.
hmr: Chun, Isûn, “Ni e, Mihriem Naupa hi thilthawtheina chang tienga ṭhunga, vân sûm laia hung la hmûng in tih,” a ta.

en: And the high priest rent his clothes, and saith, What further need have we of witnesses?
hmr: Chun, Thiempu laltak chun a silfênhai a keithlêr a, “Hretu dang ieng dingin am ngai tâng ei ta?

en: Ye have heard the blasphemy: what think ye? And they all condemned him to be worthy of death.
hmr: Pathien a hrilsietzie hlak chu in hriet tah a; iengtin am in ngai?” a ta. Chun, an rêngin ama chu thi tlâkah an ruot tâwl tah a.

en: And some began to spit on him, and to cover his face, and to buffet him, and to say unto him, Prophesy: and the officers received him with blows of their hands.
hmr: Chuongchun, aṭhen lem chun chil an sâk khum phut nghâl el tah a, a hmai an tuom a, an vuok a, a kuomah, “Hril rawh!” an tih a. Chun, manmihai khawm chun chel pumin an ben sawk sawk a.

en: And as Peter was beneath in the court, there cometh one of the maids of the high priest;
hmr: Chun, Peter chu hnuoi tienga in inhuonna sûng tuollaia a um laiin, Thiempu Laltak rawngbâwltu nu- nghâkhai laia pakhat a hung a.

en: and seeing Peter warming himself, she looked upon him, and saith, Thou also wast with the Nazarene, even Jesus.
hmr: Peter mei lum awi chu a hmuh a, a en zing a, “Nang khawm hi Isu Nazareth mi kuoma um kha i ni hi,” a ta.

en: But he denied, saying, I neither know, nor understand what thou sayest: and he went out into the porch; and the cock crew.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “I thu hril chu ka hriet naw tawp el, a ngaina hrim hrim khawm ka hriet naw tawp el,” tîn ân phah a. Chun, tuolkawt bula chun a va suok a, chuongchun, âr a khuong tah a.

en: And the maid saw him, and began again to say to them that stood by, This is one of them.
hmr: Chun, nunghâk chun a hmuh a, a kâwla ngîrhai kuoma chun, “Hi mipa hi anni laia mi a nih,” a ti nâwk a. Nisienlakhawm, ân pha nâwk a.

en: But he again denied it. And after a little while again they that stood by said to Peter, Of a truth thou art one of them; for thou art a Galilæan.
hmr: Chun, a nakie deu chun a kâwla ngîrhai chun Peter kuomah, “Anni laia mi i ni ngei hi maw, Galili rama mi i ni sih a,” an tih a.

en: But he began to curse, and to swear, I know not this man of whom ye speak.
hmr: Ama ruok chun, “Chu mihriem in hril chu ka hriet naw tawp,” tiin ṭawngsie inphurin ân khâm a.

en: And straightway the second time the cock crew. And Peter called to mind the word, how that Jesus said unto him, Before the cock crow twice, thou shalt deny me thrice. And when he thought thereon, he wept.
hmr: Chun, âr khuong vawi hnina chu a khuong nghâl tah a; chun, Peter chun Isûn a kuoma, “Âr vawi hni a khuong hmain nangin vawi thum mîn phat i tih,” a ti thu kha a hung hriet suok tah a. Chuongchun, chu thu chu a ngaituoin a ṭap tah a.

en: And straightway in the morning the chief priests with the elders and scribes, and the whole council, held a consultation, and bound Jesus, and carried him away, and delivered him up to Pilate.
hmr: Chun, zîngkâr a hung ni phingleh thiempuhai chu upa- hai le Dân inchûktirtuhai le rorêltuhai po po leh an inrâwn a, Isu chu an phier a, an ṭhuoi a, Pilat kuomah an pêk nghâl tah a.

en: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering saith unto him, Thou sayest.
hmr: Chun, Pilat chun a kuomah, “Judahai lal i ni am a nih?” tiin ân dawn a; ama chun, “I hril ang chun ka nih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And the chief priests accused him of many things.
hmr: Chun, thiempuhai chun kawng tamtakin an hêk a.

en: And Pilate again asked him, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they accuse thee of.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin ân dawn nâwk a, a kuomah, “Iengkhawmin i dawn naw maw? Ngai ta, an hêkna zozai che hi,” a ta.

en: But Jesus no more answered anything; insomuch that Pilate marvelled.
hmr: Isu ruok chun iengkhawmin a dawn ta nawh a: chuleichun, Pilat chun mak a ti hle a.

en: Now at the feast he used to release unto them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.
hmr: Chun, Pilatin Ruoiṭhe ni chun mi intâng pakhat an ngên taphawt chu ân suopêk hlak a.

en: And there was one called Barabbas, lying bound with them that had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat Barabba an ti chu, helhai laia phiera intâng ve zing a na, chuonghai chun an helnaa chun tuol an that a nih.

en: And the multitude went up and began to ask him to do as he was wont to do unto them.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu an hang feh a, an ta dinga a thawpêk hlak anga thaw dingin an ngên tah a.

en: And Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin an kuomah, “Judahai lal hi insuopêk lang cheu in nuom am?” a ta.

en: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.
hmr: (Thiempu lalhaiin an îtsîk leiin an hung ṭhuoi a ni ti a hriet sih a).

en: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Thiempu lal- hai chun mipuihai chu Barabba chu insuopêk lem dinga hni dingin an infui a.

en: And Pilate again answered and said unto them, What then shall I do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?
hmr: Chun, Pilat chun an kuomah, “Anleh Judahai lal in ti hi iengtin am thaw tâng ka ta?” tiin a dawn nâwk a.

en: And they cried out again, Crucify him.
hmr: Anni chun, “Krawsah hemde rawh,” tiin an khêk nâwk a.

en: And Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out exceedingly, Crucify him.
hmr: Pilat chun an kuomah, “Iengdingin am ie? Ieng am a suksuol leh?” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, anni chu, “Krawsah hemde rawh,” tiin an khêk zuol sau a!

en: And Pilate, wishing to content the multitude, released unto them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin mipuihai suklungawi a nuom a, Barabba chu ân suopêk tah a. Chun, Isu chu a vuok zoin krawsa hemde dingin a pêk tah a.

en: And the soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Prætorium; and they call together the whole band.
hmr: Chun, sipaihai chun in inhuonna sûng tuollai Praitorion an tia chun ama chu an ṭhuoi lût a, an pâwla mi po po an ko khâwm a.

en: And they clothe him with purple, and platting a crown of thorns, they put it on him;
hmr: Chuongchun, puon sen duk an insiltir a, hlingin lukhum an phier a, an inkhumtir a.

en: and they began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!
hmr: Chuongchun, “Chibai, Judahai Lal,” tiin chibai an bûk a.

en: And they smote his head with a reed, and spat upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.
hmr: Chun, a lua chun luongin an vuok a, chil an sâk khum a, dingṭhaṭhuonin chibai an bûk a.

en: And when they had mocked him, they took off from him the purple, and put on him his garments. And they lead him out to crucify him.
hmr: Chun, nuiza siemnaa an hmang zo chun, puon sen duk chu an hlîp a, ama puon an insiltir nâwk a. Krawsah hemde dingin an ṭhuoi suok tah a.

en: And they compel one passing by, Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.
hmr: Chun, mi invâk mei mei pakhat, rama inthawka hung, Simon Kurinia um, Alexander le Rufa pa chu a kraws puttu dingin an man a.

en: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu Golgotha hmunah an ṭhuoi a, (chu chu “Luru hmun” tina a nih).

en: And they offered him wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.
hmr: Chun, uoin murra le pawl an pêk a,nisienlakhawm, a lâk nuom nawh a.

en: And they crucify him, and part his garments among them, casting lots upon them, what each should take.
hmr: Chun, krawsah an hemdeh a, an chang ding hrietna dingin, aisânin a silfênhai chu an insem a.

en: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.
hmr: Chun, Isu an hemde hun chu vairik lai a nih.

en: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
hmr: Chun, a hêkna lekha a chungah an ziek a, “JUDAHAI LAL,” tiin.

en: And with him they crucify two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.
hmr: Chun, ama ruol chun suom- hmang pahni an hemde veh a, a chang- tieng pakhat, a vawitieng pakhat.
[Pathien Lekhathu, “Bawsetu- hai leh tiemsain a um tah” ti kha a hung tlung tah a.]

en: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ha! thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,
hmr: Chun, mi fe vêl po chun an lu thinin, “A hei! nang Pathien biekin ṭhiek a, ni thum kâra bâwl nâwktu,

en: save thyself, and come down from the cross.
hmr: insukdam la kraws lêra kha hung ṭum ta la,” tiin an ti el a.

en: In like manner also the chief priests mocking him among themselves with the scribes said, He saved others; himself he cannot save.
hmr: Chuong ang bawkin thiempu lalhai chun, Dân inchûktirtuhai leh, anni lai chun ti elin, “Mi dang hman a sukdam hlak a, ama ân sukdam thei si nawh a.

en: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.
hmr: Ei hmuh a, ei awi theina dingin Krista, Israelhai lal chu, tuhin kraws lêra inthawkin hung ṭum ta sienla,” an ta. Chun, ama ruola an hemde vehai khawm chun ama chu an hal a.

en: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.
hmr: Chun, nisa inding huna chun, zânbu suong pha chenin khawvêl a hung inthim ta vawng a.

en: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?
hmr: Chun, zânbu suong phâ chun Isu chu râwl inringtakin, “Eloi, Eloi, lama sabakthani?” tiin a khêk suok a. (Chu chu “Ka Pathien, ka Pathien, iengdinga i mi mâksan?” tina a nih).

en: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elijah.
hmr: Chun, a kuoma ngîr ṭhenkhat chun chu chu an hrietin, “Ngai ta u, Elija a ko a nih,” an ta.

en: And one ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let be; let us see whether Elijah cometh to take him down.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat a tlân a, sponj uoin thûra inchie sipin, hmawl lêrah a târ a, a hang indâwntir a. “Hun raw se, ama la thla dingin Elija a hung am en ei tiu,” an ta.

en: And Jesus uttered a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu râwl inringtakin a khêk a, a thlarau ân thla tah a.

en: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom.
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina puonzâr chu a chungtienga inthawkin a mawng tlung rakin a lo inthlêr suo tah a.

en: And when the centurion, who stood by over against him, saw that he so gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.
hmr: Chun, a hmaa sipai za hotu ngîr chun, a thlarau chuonga ân thla a hmu chun, “Hi mipa hi Pathien Naupa a ni ngei el,” a ta.

en: And there were also women beholding from afar: among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;
hmr: Chun, nuhmeihai khawm hlataka thlîrin an um a; chuhai lai chun, Mari Magdalin hai, Mari, Jakob chîn le Jose nu hai dâm, le Salomi hai an ṭhang a, (chuonghai chu Galili rama a um laia ama zuia a rawng bâwlpêk hlak hai chu an nih);

en: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him; and many other women that came up with him unto Jerusalem.
