hmr: nuhmei dang tamtak Jeru- salema ama ruola hang fe vehai chu an ṭhang bawk a.

en: And when even was now come, because it was the Preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,
hmr: Chun, zântieng a hung ni chun Inringlâwk ni a ni leiin (chu chu Châwlni hmaa ni hi a nih),

en: there came Joseph of Arimathæa, a councillor of honorable estate, who also himself was looking for the kingdom of God; and he boldly went in unto Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.
hmr: Josef Arimathaia mi, rorêltu inzaum, Pathien ram beisei ve mi bawk, a hung a, huoitakin Pilat kuomah a lût a, Isu ruong chu a hni tah a.

en: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin a thi vak chu mak a ti hle a; sipai za hotu chu a ko a, a thina a sâwt ta amanih ti ân dawn a.

en: And when he learned it of the centurion, he granted the corpse to Joseph.
hmr: Chun, sipai za hotu baua thu a hriet phing chun a ruong chu Josef kuomah a pêk a.

en: And he bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been hewn out of a rock; and he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.
hmr: Chun, ama chun puon innêm ân châwk a, ama chu a lâk thlâk a, puon innêm chun a tuom a, thlân, lung inkerkuoah ân zâl a, thlân kawtkhâr chu lungin ân del a.

en: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
hmr: Chun, Mari Magdalin le Josef nu Mari chun an inzâlna chu an hmu zing a.

en: And when the sabbath was past, Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James, and Salome, bought spices, that they might come and anoint him.
hmr: Chun, Châwlni a hung bo chun Mari Magdalin hai, Mari Jakob nu hai, Salomi hai chun ama nâl dinga an va fe theina ding chun thil riminhnik an inchâwk a.

en: And very early on the first day of the week, they come to the tomb when the sun was risen.
hmr: Chuongchun, ni saria ni hma- sataka, zîngkâr nisa suok hnungin, thlân chu an va tlung a.

en: And they were saying among themselves, Who shall roll us away the stone from the door of the tomb?
hmr: Chun, “Thlân kawta lung chu tuin am mîn hlum hmangpêk a ta?” an inti lai zingin,

en: and looking up, they see that the stone is rolled back: for it was exceeding great.
hmr: an hang nghah a, lung chu inhlum hmang sain an hang hmu tah a, a lien hle sih a.

en: And entering into the tomb, they saw a young man sitting on the right side, arrayed in a white robe; and they were amazed.
hmr: Chun, thlân sûngah an lût a, tlangvâl pakhat puon vâr silin changtieng panga ṭhung an hmuh a; an lunginzîng tah a.

en: And he saith unto them, Be not amazed: ye seek Jesus, the Nazarene, who hath been crucified: he is risen; he is not here: behold, the place where they laid him!
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chun an kuomah, “Lunginzing naw ro, Isu Nazareth mi, an hemde kha in zawng a ni âwm a, a thonâwk tah a, hi hin a um ta nawh; en ta u, an inzâlna hi.

en: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, He goeth before you into Galilee: there shall ye see him, as he said unto you.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, fe unla a închûktirhai le Peter kuoma chun, ‘Galili ramah in hmaa a fe ding a na; in kuoma a hril ang ngei khan chu chun hmûng in tih,’ tiin hril ro,” a ta.

en: And they went out, and fled from the tomb; for trembling and astonishment had come upon them: and they said nothing to any one; for they were afraid.
hmr: Chuongchun, an inthin a, an lunginzîng hle lai chun, an suok a, thlâna inthawk chun an tlân ta vang vang a, an ṭi luotin tu kuoma khawm iengkhawm an hril nawh a.

en: Now when he was risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.
hmr: [Chun, ni saria ni hmasatak, zîngkâra a thonâwk chun, Mari Magdalin, a sûnga inthawka khawhri pasari a hnawt suokpêk kuoma khan ân lâr hmasatak a.

en: She went and told them that had been with him, as they mourned and wept.
hmr: Chun, ama chu Isu umpui hlakhai kuomah a va feh a, mithi ngaia an ṭaplai chu a hril tah a.

en: And they, when they heard that he was alive, and had been seen of her, disbelieved.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun, a hring nâwk a, hmu khawm a hmu ti chu an hriet dea chu an awi si nawh a.

en: And after these things he was manifested in another form unto two of them, as they walked, on their way into the country.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun anni laia pahni ram tieng pana an fe laiin hmêl danglam putin an kuomah ân lâr nâwk a.

en: And they went away and told it unto the rest: neither believed they them.
hmr: Chun, anni chun inchûktir danghai kuomah an va hril a, anni thu khawm chu an awi chuong nawh a.

en: And afterward he was manifested unto the eleven themselves as they sat at meat; and he upbraided them with their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they believed not them that had seen him after he was risen.
hmr: Chun, chu hnung nâwka chun buthlêng an awt laiin sâwm le pakhat hai kuom ngeiah ân lâr nâwk a, a thonâwk hnunga a hmutuhai thu chu an awi naw leiin an awi nawna le an lungril ngar kawnga chun a kâwk tâwl a.

en: And he said unto them, Go ye into all the world, and preach the gospel to the whole creation.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah, “Khawvêl po poah fe unla, thilsiemhai po po kuomah Chanchin Ṭha hi hril ro.

en: He that believeth and is baptized shall be saved; but he that disbelieveth shall be condemned.
hmr: Awia, baptisma chang chu sandamin um an tih; a awi naw ruok chu thiemnaw changin um an tih.

en: And these signs shall accompany them that believe: in my name shall they cast out demons; they shall speak with new tongues;
hmr: Chun, hieng inchiknahai hin a awituhai chu zui pei a tih: Ka hmingin khawhrihai hnawt dawk an ta, ṭawng tharhaiin ṭawng an tih.

en: they shall take up serpents, and if they drink any deadly thing, it shall in no wise hurt them; they shall lay hands on the sick, and they shall recover.
hmr: Rûlhai kut chungah dawm an ta, thina tûr iengang khawm dâwn hai sienla iengkhawm ti naw ni hai; damnawhai chungah an kut innghat an ta, dam pei an tih,” a ta.

en: So then the Lord Jesus, after he had spoken unto them, was received up into heaven, and sat down at the right hand of God.
hmr: Chuongchun, Lal Isu chu an kuoma thu a hril zo chun vâna zuk ṭhuoiin a um tah a, Pathien changtieng a hang ṭhung tah a.

en: And they went forth, and preached everywhere, the Lord working with them, and confirming the word by the signs that followed. Amen.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu an fe suok a, ram tinah thu an hril tah a; Lalpain anni ân thlawppui a, a zuitu inchiknahai chun an thu chu a sukdet pei a, Amen].

en: And when he entered again into Capernaum after some days, it was noised that he was in the house.
hmr: Chun, ni ieng zât amani hnunga Kapernaum a hung lût nâwkin, inah ama a um ti thu ân thang tah a.

en: And many were gathered together, so that there was no longer room for them, no, not even about the door: and he spake the word unto them.
hmr: Chuongchun, kawt bula khawm umna um naw khawp rakin, mi tamtak an hung khâwm a; an kuoma chun thu a hril tah a.

en: And they come, bringing unto him a man sick of the palsy, borne of four.
hmr: Chun, mi zeng pakhat, mi palia zâwn a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a.

en: And when they could not come nigh unto him for the crowd, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed whereon the sick of the palsy lay.
hmr: Chun, mipui leia Isu kâwl hnai an tlung thei naw leiin, a umna in chung chu an ṭhiek tah a; chuonga an ṭhiek zo phing chun mi zeng chu a puonpha pum chun an zuk thlâk tah a.

en: And Jesus seeing their faith saith unto the sick of the palsy, Son, thy sins are forgiven.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn an ringzie chu a lo hmuh a, mi zeng kuoma chun, “Naupa, i suolhai ngaidam a ni tah,” a ta.

en: But there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
hmr: Chun, Dân inchûktirtu ṭhenkhat chutaka chun an ṭhung a, an lungril chun hieng hin an ngaituoh a,

en: Why doth this man thus speak? he blasphemeth: who can forgive sins but one, even God?
hmr: “Hi mipa hin ieng dinga hieng thu hi hril am a ni leh? Pathien a hrilsiet a ni hi. Mi pakhat, Pathien chau naw chun tuin am suolhai a ngaidam thei a?” tiin.

en: And straightway Jesus, perceiving in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, saith unto them, Why reason ye these things in your hearts?
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu an ngaituo a ni ti Isûn a lungrilin a hriet nghâl tah a, an kuomah, “Chuong thu chu iengdinga in lungrila in ngaituo am a na?

en: Which is easier, to say to the sick of the palsy, Thy sins are forgiven; or to say, Arise, and take up thy bed, and walk?
hmr: Zeng kuoma chun, ‘I suol ngai- dam a ni tah,’ ti le, ‘I puonpha la la, kein fe ta rawh,’ ti hi a ieng am hril a awl lem a?

en: But that ye may know that the Son of man hath authority on earth to forgive sins (he saith to the sick of the palsy),
hmr: Iengkhawm ni sienla, khawvêla hin, Mihriem Naupan suol ngaidam theina a nei ti in hrietna dingin,” (Zeng kuoma chun)

en: I say unto thee, Arise, take up thy bed, and go unto thy house.
hmr: “Tho la, i puonpha la la, i inah fe ta rawh, ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And he arose, and straightway took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu a tho a, a puonpha chu a lâk a, an rênga mithmu ngei chun a suok tah a; chuongchun, an rêngin mak an ti hle a, “Hieng ang hrim hrim hi ei la hmu ngai nawh,” tîn Pathien an inpâk tah a.

en: And he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
hmr: Chun, a suok nâwk a, dîl panga chun a fe tah a; chun mipui po po chu a kuomah an va feh a, a lo inchûktir tah a.

en: And as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphæus sitting at the place of toll, and he saith unto him, Follow me. And he arose and followed him.
hmr: Chun, a fe malamin, Levi, Alphai naupa chu siechawina hmuna ṭhung a hmuh a, a kuomah, “Mi hung zui rawh,” a ta. Ama chu a tho a, a zui tah a.

en: And it came to pass, that he was sitting at meat in his house, and many publicans and sinners sat down with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
hmr: Chun, Isu chun Levi inah thlaithlêng a awt a; siedâwltuhai le mi suol tamtakin a închûktirhai chu an awtpui tâwl a, tamtak el an na, ama chu an zui ve bawk hlak.

en: And the scribes of the Pharisees, when they saw that he was eating with the sinners and publicans, said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai laia Dân inchûktirtuhaiin Isûn mi suol le siedâwltuhai a awtpui an hmuin, a închûktirhai kuoma chun, “Iengtiziea siedâwltuhai lai a fâkin a dâwn am a na?” an ta.

en: And when Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They that are whole have no need of a physician, but they that are sick: I came not to call the righteous, but sinners.
hmr: Chun, Isûn chu chu a lo hriet a, “Mi hrâthai chun dâktawr an ngai nawh a, mi hrivawisiehai lemin an ngai a nih; mi feltakhai indawn dinga hung ka ni nawh a, mi suolhai lem indawn dinga hung ka nih,” a ta.

en: And John’s disciples and the Pharisees were fasting: and they come and say unto him, Why do John’s disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?
hmr: Chun, Pharisai le Johan in- chûktirhai chun bu an nghei a; chun, “Ieng dinga Johan inchûktirhai le Pharisai inchûktir haiin bu an nghei hlak a, i închûktirhai hlakin an nghei ve ngai naw?” an ta.

en: And Jesus said unto them, Can the sons of the bridechamber fast, while the bridegroom is with them? as long as they have the bridegroom with them, they cannot fast.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Mo ṭhuoitu- hai kuoma a pasal ding chu a um sûng po chu mo ṭhuoituhai chun bu nghei thei naw ni hai,

en: But the days will come, when the bridegroom shall be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, a pasal ding chu an kuoma inthawka ṭhuoi hmang ni la hung tlung a ta, chu nia ruok chun la nghei an tih.

en: No man seweth a piece of undressed cloth on an old garment: else that which should fill it up taketh from it, the new from the old, and a worse rent is made.
hmr: Tukhawmin puon hlui puon la rin mar lo hlekin an phâwk ngai nawh; phâwk ang sienla, a phâwkna chun keiek lem a tih, a thar chun a hlui chu keiek a ta, inek nasa det lem a tih.

en: And no man putteth new wine into old wine-skins; else the wine will burst the skins, and the wine perisheth, and the skins: but they put new wine into fresh wine-skins.
hmr: Chun, tukhawmin uoin thar savun uoin peng hluiahai an thun ngai nawh; thun ang sienla, uoin chun savun peng chu mawrdar a ta, uoin le savun peng chu bo hmang ve vêng a tih, uoin thar chu savun uoin peng tharahai an thun lem hlak a nih,” a ta.

en: And it came to pass, that he was going on the sabbath day through the grainfields; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu châwlniin bu bilahai a fe thleng a, chuongchun, a închûktirhai chun an fe malamin buvûihai chu an thliek tah a.

en: And the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai chun a kuomah, “En ta, iengdinga châwlnia thaw thieng naw chu an thaw am a na?” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, Did ye never read what David did, when he had need, and was hungry, he, and they that were with him?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “David le a ruolhai an tlâksama, an phîng a ṭâm laia an thil thaw kha in tiem naw am a nih?

en: How he entered into the house of God when Abiathar was high priest, and ate the showbread, which it is not lawful to eat save for the priests, and gave also to them that were with him?
hmr: Khânga Abiathar Thiempu Laltak a ni laia Pathien inah a lût a, Thiempuhai chau naw chun fâk thieng lo bei chu a fâk a, a ruolhai khawm a pêk ve thu kha?” a ta.

en: And he said unto them, The sabbath was made for man, and not man for the sabbath:
hmr: Chun, ama bâwkin an kuoma chun, “Châwlni hi mihriem ta dinga siem a na, mihriem hi Châwlni ta dinga siem a ni nawh;

en: so that the Son of man is lord even of the sabbath.
hmr: chuongchun, Mihriem Naupa hi Châwlni chunga chen khawm Lal a nih,” a ta.

en: And he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there who had his hand withered.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna ina chun a lût nâwk a, chutaka chun mi pakhat kutzeng hi a lo um a.

en: And they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.
hmr: Chun, ama an hêk theina dingin Châwlnin a sukdam ding le sukdam naw ding an enthlit a.

en: And he saith unto the man that had his hand withered, Stand forth.
hmr: Ama chun kutzeng kuoma chun, “Hung ngîr dawk rawh,” a ta.

en: And he saith unto them, Is it lawful on the sabbath day to do good, or to do harm? to save a life, or to kill? But they held their peace.
hmr: Chun, an kuoma chun, “Châwlni hin sukṭhat am a thieng, suksiet? sandam am a thieng sukhlum?” tiin ân dawn a. Nisienlakhawm, an to zing a.

en: And when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved at the hardening of their heart, he saith unto the man, Stretch forth thy hand. And he stretched it forth; and his hand was restored.
hmr: Chun, an lungril ngar zie chu pawitipêk bêk bêkin, lungsen puma anni a en vêl hnungin, chu mipa kuoma chun, “I kut phar rawh,” a ta. Chun, a hang phar dawk a, a kut chu a dam tah a.

en: And the Pharisees went out, and straightway with the Herodians took counsel against him, how they might destroy him.
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai chu an suok a, ama an sukhlum theinazie ding ngaituoin Herod pâwla mihai le chun an inrâwn nghâl tah a.

en: And Jesus with his disciples withdrew to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed; and from Judæa,
hmr: Chun, Isu chu a inchûktirhai le chun dîl tieng an fe hmang tah a, chuongchun, Galili rama inthawkin mipui nasatakin an zui tah a.

en: and from Jerusalem, and from Idumæa, and beyond the Jordan, and about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, hearing what great things he did, came unto him.
hmr: Chun, a thil thaw ropuizie chu an hrietin, Judai rama inthawk dâmin, Jerusalema inthawk dâmin, Idumai rama inthawk dâmin, Tura le Sidon khuo vêla inthawk dâmin mipui nasatak a kuomah an hung veh a.

en: And he spake to his disciples, that a little boat should wait on him because of the crowd, lest they should throng him:
hmr: Chun, mipui lei chun a ta dinga lawnglêng pakhat lo siemrêlpêk dingin a închûktirhai a hril a. “Chuong naw chun mi hneng hut hut rawi an tih,” a ta.

en: for he had healed many; insomuch that as many as had plagues pressed upon him that they might touch him.
hmr: Mi tamtak a sukdam nghâl tah a; chuongchun, natna nei po po chun ama an them theina dingin an bûm tul tul a.

en: And the unclean spirits, whensoever they beheld him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
hmr: Khawhri inthieng nawhai khawmin ama an hmu po leh a hmaa bawkkhupin, “Nang Pathien Naupa chu i nih,” tiin an khêk hlak a.

en: And he charged them much that they should not make him known.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a chanchin chu phuong lo dingin an kuomah a ti tlat pei a.

en: And he goeth up into the mountain, and calleth unto him whom he himself would; and they went unto him.
hmr: Chun, tlânga chun a hang feh a, amain a dit pohai chu a ko a, chuongchun, anni chu a kuomah an hang feh a.

en: And he appointed twelve, that they might be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
hmr: Chun, sâwm le pahni a ruot a, a kuoma an um theina dingin le thu hril dinga a tir dawk theina ding le,

en: and to have authority to cast out demons:
hmr: khawhrihai hnawt dawkna thu nei dinga a tir dawk theina dingin.

en: and Simon he surnamed Peter;
hmr: Chuonghai chu, Simon, Peter a înbûk hai;

en: and James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and them he surnamed Boanerges, which is, Sons of thunder:
hmr: Zebedai naupa Jakob le Jakob unaupa Johan hai dâm, (chuonghai chu “Boanerges” ân bûk a, chu chu “Vâninrûm Nauhai,” tina a nih.)

en: and Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphæus, and Thaddæus, and Simon the Cananæan,
hmr: Andri hai, Philip hai, Bartholomai hai, Matthai hai, Thoma hai, Alphai naupa Jakob hai, Thaddai hai, Kanaana Simon hai;

en: and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him. And he cometh into a house.
hmr: a înmantirtu Juda Iskariot hai dâm kha an nih.

en: And the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
hmr: Chun, inah a va lût a. Chun, mipui chu an hung khâwm nâwk a, chuongchun, bei takngiel khawm an fâk thei ta nawh a.

en: And when his friends heard it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
hmr: Chun, a sûnghai chun chu chu an hriet a, “ân vêt a ni chu tie,” tiin, ama man tumin an inthawk a.

en: And the scribes that came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and, By the prince of the demons casteth he out the demons.
hmr: Chun, Dân Inchûktirtuhai Jeru- salema inthawka hung thlahai chun, “Beelzebub a zâwl a ni hi,” an tih a. “Khawhri lal lei annâwm khawhrihai a hnawt dawk hlak hi,” an ti bawk a.

en: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?
hmr: Chun, Isu chun Dân inchûk- tirtuhai chu a ko a, tekhithuin an kuomah, “Setanin Setan bawk ieng- tin am hnawt dawk thei a ta?

en: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.
hmr: Ram khawm ama le ama ân do chun, chu ram chu ngîr suok thei naw ni.

en: And if a house be divided against itself, that house will not be able to stand.
hmr: Sûng khat khawm anni le anni an indo chun, chuhai sûng chu ngîr suok thei naw ni hai.

en: And if Satan hath risen up against himself, and is divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.
hmr: Setan khawm ama le ama indo a, ân khing si chun, ngîr suok thei naw nih a, bohmang el lem a tih.

en: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man, and spoil his goods, except he first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.
hmr: Tukhawm mi hrât ina lûtin a sum chu a lâkpêk thei ngai nawh, mi hrât chu an phier hmasa zet naw chun; chu hnunga ruok chun a in chu inrampêk el an tih.

en: Verily I say unto you, All their sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and their blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:
hmr: Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, mihriem nauhai hi an suolna po poa le, Pathien hrilsietna kawng tinrênga an hrilsietnahaia khawm chun ngaidam nîng an tih;

en: but whosoever shall blaspheme against the Holy Spirit hath never forgiveness, but is guilty of an eternal sin:
hmr: tukhawm Thlarau Inthieng meu hrilsetu ruok chun ienglai khawmin ngaidamna hmu naw ni, kumkhaw- tluonga suolna kawnga chun inthiem loin um ta lem a tih,” a tih a.

en: because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.
hmr: (“Khawhri inthieng naw a zâwl a nih,” an ti lei khan chu chu a hril a nih.)

en: And there come his mother and his brethren; and, standing without, they sent unto him, calling him.
hmr: Chun, a nu le a unauhai chu an hung a, tuolah an ngîr a, ama ko dingin mi an tir a.

en: And a multitude was sitting about him; and they say unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.
hmr: Chun, a sîr vêl lai chun mipui an lo ṭhung tâwl a; chun, a kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, tuola sawn i nu le i unauhaiin an zawng che,” an ta.

en: And he answereth them, and saith, Who is my mother and my brethren?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Ka nu le ka unauhai chu tuhai am an na?” tiin an dawn a.

en: And looking round on them that sat round about him, he saith, Behold, my mother and my brethren!
hmr: Chun, a kâwla ṭhunghai chu a hei en vêl a, “En ta u, ka nu le ka unauhai hi!

en: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and sister, and mother.
hmr: Tukhawm Pathien dit zâwng thawtu phawt chu, chuonghai ngei chu ka unauhai, ka farnuhai, ka nuhai an nih annâwm,” a ta.

en: And again he began to teach by the sea side. And there is gathered unto him a very great multitude, so that he entered into a boat, and sat in the sea; and all the multitude were by the sea on the land.
hmr: Chun, dîl panga chun ân chûktir nâwk tah a. Chun, mipui nasatak el a kuomah an hung inkhâwm a; chuongchun, dîla chun lawngah a chuong a, a ṭhung a; mipuihai po po chu dîl panga khawmuola chun an um a.

en: And he taught them many things in parables, and said unto them in his teaching,
hmr: Chun, tekhithuin thu tamtak ân chûktir a, ân chûktirnaa chun,

en: Hearken: Behold, the sower went forth to sow:
hmr: “Ngai unla en ta u, bu chi thetu bu chi thein a feh a,

en: and it came to pass, as he sowed, some seed fell by the way side, and the birds came and devoured it.
hmr: chun, a the laiin a ṭhen lampui sîrah a tlah a, vatehaiin an hung tlân zo tah a.

en: And other fell on the rocky ground, where it had not much earth; and straightway it sprang up, because it had no deepness of earth:
hmr: Chun, a ṭhen chu pielthlêng chung, hnuoi inphânna lai a tlah a, hnuoi a sa naw leiin a mâwng nghâl tah a,

en: and when the sun was risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, nisa a hung insâng pha em vuoiin a um a, zung a nei naw leiin a rawp ta el a.

en: And other fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
hmr: Chun, a ṭhen chu hlohlingnei lai a tlah a, hlo chu a hung mâwng sâng a, a dîp hmang tah a, ra hrim hrim a ra ta nawh a.

en: And others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing; and brought forth, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.
hmr: Chun, a ṭhen hnuoiṭhaah a tlah a, a mâwng a, ân ṭhang lien a, a ra tah a; sâwmthum dâm, sâwmruk dâm, za dâmin a pung tâwl tah a,” a ta.

en: And he said, Who hath ears to hear, let him hear.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin, “Tukhawm hrietna dinga na nei chun hre raw se,” a ta.

en: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parables.
hmr: Chun, fienriela a um laiin a kuoma sâwm le pahnihai le um mi danghai chun tekhithuhai chu an indawn fel a.

en: And he said unto them, Unto you is given the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all things are done in parables:
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Pathien ram thurûk chu nangni hai hriet chu phal a na, puotienga mihai ta ding ruok chun iengkim tekhithua hril a nih;

en: that seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest haply they should turn again, and it should be forgiven them.
hmr: chuongchun, ‘Hmu chu an hmu thei deh a, hriet ruok chu an hriet thei nawna ding le na ruok chun an hriet thei deh a, a ngaina ruok chu an hriet thei nawna dingin, chuong naw chun ngha kîr nawk an ta, ngaidam hung ni hlau rawi an tih,’” a ta.

en: And he saith unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how shall ye know all the parables?
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin, an kuoma chun, “Hi tekhithu hi in hriet thei naw maw? Chuongchu a ni chun iengtin am tekhithu danghai po po chu hre hrim in ta?

en: The sower soweth the word.
hmr: Bu chi thetu chun thu chu a the a nih.

en: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; and when they have heard, straightway cometh Satan, and taketh away the word which hath been sown in them.
hmr: Chun, lampui sîra thu thênahai chu hieng hi an nih; thu an hriet phingleh Setan chun an lungrila thu thea um chu a lâkpêk nghâl hlak.

en: And these in like manner are they that are sown upon the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, straightway receive it with joy;
hmr: Chun, chuong ang bawk chun pielthlêng chunga the chu hieng hi an nih: thu chu an hriet phinga lâwmtaka pawm nghâl el hlakhai hi;

en: and they have no root in themselves, but endure for a while; then, when tribulation or persecution ariseth because of the word, straightway they stumble.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, annia chun zung hrim an nei nawh a, sâwt nâwte chau an um a, thu leia rinumna amanih, suknawmnatna amanih a hung um phing leh an tlu nghâl el hlak a nih.

en: And others are they that are sown among the thorns; these are they that have heard the word,
hmr: Chun, mi danghai chu hlohling- nei laia the chu an nih, chuonghai chun thu chu an hriet tah a;

en: and the cares of the world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, khawvêl lung- khamnahai, hausakna hlêmnahai, thil dang châknahai chu a hung lût a, thu chu a dîp a, ra loin a lo um hlak.

en: And those are they that were sown upon the good ground; such as hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, thirtyfold, and sixtyfold, and a hundredfold.
hmr: Chun, hnuoi ṭhaa thehai chu hieng hi an nih: thu chu hrea, pawm a, a lêt sâwmthum dâm, a lêt sâwmruk dâm, a lêt za dâma rahai hi,” a ta.

en: And he said unto them, Is the lamp brought to be put under the bushel, or under the bed, and not to be put on the stand?
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin an kuomah, “Khâwnvar chu a sienaa sie loa lei- khâwr hnuoia manih, khum hnuoia manih sie dingin an hung lâk hlak am a nih?

en: For there is nothing hid, save that it should be manifested; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.
hmr: Inphuong naw dinga ip ieng- khawm a um nghâl nawh a, inlang lo dinga thuphmang iengkhawm a um bawk nawh.

en: If any man hath ears to hear, let him hear.
hmr: Tukhawmin hrietna dinga na nei chun hre raw se,” a ta.

en: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete it shall be measured unto you; and more shall be given unto you.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin an kuoma chun, “In thu ngai chu nguntakin ngaituo ro, in inkhîna ngai bawkin inkhi pêk an ti cheu a, pe tam lem hman hman an ti cheu.

en: For he that hath, to him shall be given: and he that hath not, from him shall be taken away even that which he hath.
hmr: Tukhawm a nei chu pe sâng an ta, tukhawm a nei naw chu a nei sun khawm lâkpêk an tih,” a ta.

en: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed upon the earth;
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin, “Pathien ram chu hieng ang hi a nih; mîn hnuoia hin chi the sienla, zâna inin sûnah tho hlak sienla;

en: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, he knoweth not how.
hmr: a umzie a hriet loin hung mâwngin hung inṭhang sienla, chuong ang chu a nih.

en: The earth beareth fruit of herself; first the blade, then the ear, then the full grain in the ear.
hmr: Hnuoi hin amain ra a hung insuo hlak, a phut chun a kûng, chu zoa chun a ra, chun chu zo nâwka chun a vûia bu mal kim chu.

en: But when the fruit is ripe, straightway he putteth forth the sickle, because the harvest is come.
hmr: Chun, ra chu a hung hmin pha, bu lâk a lo hun ta leiin kâwite a kei suok nghâl hlak a nih,” a ta.

en: And he said, How shall we liken the kingdom of God? or in what parable shall we set it forth?
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin, “Pathien ram chu ieng lêm hrilkhîng ei tih aw? annawleh, ieng tekhithu lêm hril- khîng ei ta?

en: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown upon the earth, though it be less than all the seeds that are upon the earth,
hmr: Anṭam chi mal khat hnuoia an thein, hnuoi chunga chi po po nêkin chîntak sienla khawm;

en: yet when it is sown, groweth up, and becometh greater than all the herbs, and putteth out great branches; so that the birds of the heaven can lodge under the shadow thereof.
hmr: the zo hnung ruok chun a hung mâwng a, thlâi po po nêkin a hung lien lem tah a, zâr lientak tak dâm a hung nei a, chuongchun, chunglêng vatehai chu a buka chun an riek thei hlak; chuong ang chu a nih,” a ta.

en: And with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it;
hmr: Chuong ang tekhithu tamtakin, an ihriet thei tâwk tâwkin, thu chu an kuomah a hril hlak.

en: and without a parable spake he not unto them: but privately to his own disciples he expounded all things.
hmr: Tekhithu naw chun an kuomah thu a hril ngai nawh; ama inchûk- tirhai kuoma ruok chun fienrielah iengkim a hrilfie hlak a.

en: And on that day, when even was come, he saith unto them, Let us go over unto the other side.
hmr: Chun, chu ni ma, zântieng chun ama chun an kuomah, “Râlkhing tieng sawn kai ei tiu,” a ta.

en: And leaving the multitude, they take him with them, even as he was, in the boat. And other boats were with him.
hmr: Chuongchun, mipui chu mâk- sanin, ama chu a um ngai chun lawnga chun an fepui nghâl tah a. Lawng dang dâm khawm a kuomah a um a.

en: And there ariseth a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the boat, insomuch that the boat was now filling.
hmr: Chun, thlipui nasatak a hung hrâng a, tuifâwnhai dâm chu lawnga chun a hung insawk lût hlawp hlawp a; chuongchun, lawng chu a hung sip vâng vâng el tah a.

en: And he himself was in the stern, asleep on the cushion: and they awake him, and say unto him, Teacher, carest thou not that we perish?
hmr: Chun, ama chu lukham chu khamin lawng mei tieng chun a lo in a; chun, an keitho a, a kuoma chun, “Inchûktirtu, kan bohmang hi pawi i ti nâwm a nih?” an ta.

en: And he awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a hung har a, thli chu a hal a, dîl kuoma khawm chun, “To la, um ṭawk ṭawk rawh,” a ta. Chun, thli chu a ma a, a hung re ta ṭhup el a.

en: And he said unto them, Why are ye fearful? have ye not yet faith?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Iengdinga chuong bêk bêka ṭi am in na? Ringna hrim in la nei naw a ni maw?” a ta.

en: And they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, Who then is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
hmr: Chuongchun, ṭit namênin an ṭi ta nawh a, “Hi mipa hi tu am a ni lie? thli le dîl chen khawmin a thu an awi hi,” an inti tâwl a.

en: And they came to the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gerasenes.
hmr: Chun, dîl râl, Gerasin mihai ram chu an hung tlung a.

en: And when he was come out of the boat, straightway there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
hmr: Chun, lawnga inthawka a suok chau chun mi pakhat, khawhri inthieng naw iman thlâna inthawka hung suok chun ân tuokpui tah a;

en: who had his dwelling in the tombs: and no man could any more bind him, no, not with a chain;
hmr: chu mipa chun thlâna dâm chun umna a nei hlak a, tukhawmin khaidiet khawmin an khit thei ta nawh a;

en: because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been rent asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: and no man had strength to tame him.
hmr: kawlhai le khaidiethai khawmin an khit rawp ta hlak a, anachu khaidiethai dâm chu a keitan a, kawlhai dâm khawm chu a sukbawng pei hlak a; tukhawmin an sukdawl zo nawh a.

en: And always, night and day, in the tombs and in the mountains, he was crying out, and cutting himself with stones.
hmr: A sûn a zânin thlânahai le tlângahai chun a khêk hlak a, lung dâm khawmin ân ât rawp hlak a.

en: And when he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and worshipped him;
hmr: Chun, hlataka inthawkin Isu chu a hei hmu phingleh a tlân a, chibai a va bûk a.

en: and crying out with a loud voice, he saith, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the Most High God? I adjure thee by God, torment me not.
hmr: Chun, râwl inringtaka khêkin, “Isu, Pathien Chunghnungtak Nau- pa, kei le nang ieng am ei inzâwlna a um a? Mi sawisa naw hrâm dingin Pathien hmingin ka ngên ṭal che a nih,” a ta.

en: For he said unto him, Come forth, thou unclean spirit, out of the man.
hmr: (Isu chun a kuomah, “Nang khawhri inthieng naw, mihriem sûnga hi suok rawh,” a lo ti nghâl tah a.)

en: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he saith unto him, My name is Legion; for we are many.
hmr: Chun, Isu chun, “I hming ieng am a na?” tîn ân dawn a. Ama chun a kuomah, “Ka hming chu Nuoia a nih, tamtak kan ni sih a,” a ta.

en: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
hmr: Chun, chu rama inthawk chun anni tir hmang lo dingin Isu kuomah a ngên ṭal tah a.

en: Now there was there on the mountain side a great herd of swine feeding.
hmr: Chun, chutaka tlâng panga chun vawk ruol tamtak an tlah a.

en: And they besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.
hmr: Chun, khawhri inthieng nawhai chun, “Vawkhai kuoma sawn mîn fêtir rawh; an sûnga kan lût theina dingin,” tiin a kuomah an ngên a.

en: And he gave them leave. And the unclean spirits came out, and entered into the swine: and the herd rushed down the steep into the sea, in number about two thousand; and they were drowned in the sea.
hmr: Ama chun a phal pêk a. Chuongchun, khawhri inthieng naw- hai chu an suok a, vawkhai sûnga chun an lût a, chuongchun, vawk ruol chu (sâng hni lai an na) rawlah an tlân thlah a, dîlah an tlân lût a; chuongchun, dîla chun tui an inhâk hlum tah a.

en: And they that fed them fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they came to see what it was that had come to pass.
hmr: Chun, a vâituhai chu an tlân a, khuo le lohaia dâm chun an hril a. Chun, “Ieng am a ni ta leh?” tia en dingin an hung khâwm tâwl a.

en: And they come to Jesus, and behold him that was possessed with demons sitting, clothed and in his right mind, even him that had the legion: and they were afraid.
hmr: Chun, Isu kuom an hung tlung a, khawhri iman, nuoia iman kha, puon sila, lungril ngai puta ṭhung an hmuh a, chuongchun, an ṭi tah a.

en: And they that saw it declared unto them how it befell him that was possessed with demons, and concerning the swine.
hmr: Chun, a hretuhai chun khawhri imanpa chunga thil hung tlung zie le, vawk chanchinhai chu chuonghai kuoma chun an lo hril a.

en: And they began to beseech him to depart from their borders.
hmr: Chun, chuonghai chun Isu chu an rama inthawka suok dingin an ngên tah a.

en: And as he was entering into the boat, he that had been possessed with demons besought him that he might be with him.
hmr: Chun, lawnga a chuong ding lai takin, khawhri imanpa khan Isu kuoma um zing a ngên a.

en: And he suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go to thy house unto thy friends, and tell them how great things the Lord hath done for thee, and how he had mercy on thee.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn a phal nawh a, a kuomah, “I ina i ruolhai kuomah fe la, Lalpain thil a thawpêk che hi a ropuizie le a lunginsietzie che hi va hril rawh,” a ti ta lem a.

en: And he went his way, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men marvelled.
hmr: Chuongchun, a feh a, Dekapoli khuohaia chun Isûn a ta dinga thil a thawpêkhai ropuizie chu a khêk vêlpui tah a; chun, mi po po chun mak an ti hle a.

en: And when Jesus had crossed over again in the boat unto the other side, a great multitude was gathered unto him; and he was by the sea.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu lawnga râl khing tieng a hung kai nâwk chun, mipui nasatak a kuomah an hung khâwm a, ama chu dîl panga chun a um a.

en: And there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jaïrus by name; and seeing him, he falleth at his feet,
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna hotuhai laia mi pakhat, a hming Jaira chu a hung a, Isu a hmu phingleh a ke bulah a bawkkhup a,

en: and beseecheth him much, saying, My little daughter is at the point of death: I pray thee, that thou come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be made whole, and live.
hmr: “Ka naunu naupangte a thi vâng vâng a, a hung hara, a hung dam theina dingin, hunga a chunga i kut innghat dingin ka ngên che,” tiin a ngên ṭal a.

en: And he went with him; and a great multitude followed him, and they thronged him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu chu ama le chun an va feh a, chun, mipui nasatakin an zui a, an hneng sup sup a.

en: And a woman, who had an issue of blood twelve years,
hmr: Chun, nuhmei pakhat kum sâwmpahni thipûtin a damnawh a,

en: and had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
hmr: dâktawr tamtak kuomah nasa- takin a tuor tah a, a nei po po khawm chu a sêng zo tah a, ṭhathnem nêkin a zuol deu deu lem a.

en: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came in the crowd behind, and touched his garment.
hmr: Chu minu chun Isu chanchin a lo hriet a, a hnungah mipui lai chun a hung a, a puon chu a them a,

en: For she said, If I touch but his garments, I shall be made whole.
hmr: “A puon chau khawm them lang sukdamin um el ka tih,” a ti lungril a nih.

en: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of her plague.
hmr: Chuongchun, kârloin a thipût chu a hung bo nghâl tah a, a natna chu sukdam a ni tah ti a taksa chun ân hriet tah a.

en: And straightway Jesus, perceiving in himself that the power proceeding from him had gone forth, turned him about in the crowd, and said, Who touched my garments?
hmr: Chun, Isu chun a sûnga thil- thawtheina chu a suok ti a lo hriet a, mipui lai chun a ngha vêl nghâl tah a, “Tu am a na ka puon them kha?” a ta.

en: And his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who touched me?
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Mipuiin an hneng sup sup che hi i hmu nghâl a, ‘Tu am a na a mi them,?’ iengtiziea ti am i na?” an ta.

en: And he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a themtu chu hmu tumin a en vêl a.

en: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what had been done to her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei chun a chunga Isu thil thawzie chu hrein ṭi le inthin pumin a hung a, a hmaah a bawkkhup a, a kuomah thu indik- takin a hril vawng tah a.

en: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Ka naunu, i ringna hi i dampui a nih, lungmuongtakin fe la, i natna chu lo dam sawng ta raw se,” a ta.

en: While he yet spake, they come from the ruler of the synagogue’s house, saying, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Teacher any further?
hmr: A la ṭawng zing laiin in- khâwmna in hotu ina inthawkin mi an hung a, “I naunu a thi tah, ieng- dingin am inchûktirtu hi la suksâwl rawp i ta?” an ta.

en: But Jesus, not heeding the word spoken, saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Fear not, only believe.
hmr: Isu ruok chun, an thu hril chu ngaisak loin inkhâwmna in hotu kuoma chun, “Ṭi naw, awi el rawh,” a ta.

en: And he suffered no man to follow with him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
hmr: Chun, Peter hai, Jakob hai, Jakob unau Johan hai chau naw chu tukhawm ama zui ve a phal ta nawh a.

en: And they come to the house of the ruler of the synagogue; and he beholdeth a tumult, and many weeping and wailing greatly.
hmr: Chun, inkhâwmna in hotu in chu an va tlung a, Isu chun an lo buoi mur mur le, an lo ṭap veng vung a, an khêk tuor tuor chu a va hmuh a.

en: And when he was entered in, he saith unto them, Why make ye a tumult, and weep? the child is not dead, but sleepeth.
hmr: Chun, a va lût chun, an kuomah, “Iengdinga inri veng vunga ṭap am in na? naupang chu a thi nawh, a in lem a nih,” a ta.

en: And they laughed him to scorn. But he, having put them all forth, taketh the father of the child and her mother and them that were with him, and goeth in where the child was.
hmr: Anni hlak chun an nuisan el a; ama hlak chun an rêngin a hnawt dawk a, naupang nu le pa le a kuoma umhai chu a ṭhuoi a, naupang umnaa chun a va lût a.

en: And taking the child by the hand, he saith unto her, Talitha cumi; which is, being interpreted, Damsel, I say unto thee, Arise.
hmr: Chun, naupang kut chu a chel a, a kuoma chun, “Talitha kumi,” a ta. Chu chu, “Bawinu tho rawh ka ti che,” tina a nih.

en: And straightway the damsel rose up, and walked; for she was twelve years old. And they were amazed straightway with a great amazement.
hmr: Chun, naupangnu chu a hung tho a, a fe thei nghâl tah a; ama chu kum sâwmpahni mi a ni hrim tah a. Chun, anni chun namênin mak an ti nawh a.

en: And he charged them much that no man should know this: and he commanded that something should be given her to eat.
hmr: Chun, amân an kuomah, “Hi hi tukhawmin hre naw raw hai se,” a ti tlat a, chun fâk ding pêk ding thu a pêk tah a.

en: And he went out from thence; and he cometh into his own country; and his disciples follow him.
hmr: Chutaka chu a suok a, a umna khuo tieng chu a tlung nâwk tah a; inchûktirhai chun an zui pei a.

en: And when the sabbath was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, Whence hath this man these things? and, What is the wisdom that is given unto this man, and what mean such mighty works wrought by his hands?
hmr: Chun, Châwlni a hung na, inkhâwmna inah ân chûktir tah a. Chuongchun, mi tamtak a thu hre hai chun, “Hi mipa hin hieng thu hi khawlaia inthawka a hriet am a na? Hi mipa kuoma pêka um hi ieng varna am a na? A kut ngeiin thil mak tak tak a thaw hi iengtizie am a na?

en: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, and Joses, and Judas, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended in him.
hmr: Hi mipa hi Mari naupa, Jakob hai, Jose hai, Juda hai, Simon hairawi unaupa, thingrem siemtu kha a ni naw am a nih? A farnuhai khawm hitaka ei kuoma um an ni nâwm a nih?” an ta, mak an ti hle a. Chuongchun, a chungah an lungni ta nawh a.

en: And Jesus said unto them, A prophet is not without honor, save in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Zâwlnei chu ama khuo tienga dâm, ama laibunghai lai dâm, ama ina hai dâm chau naw chun inpâk loin a um ngai nawh,” a ta.

en: And he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.
hmr: Chun, mi damnaw tlâwmte chunga kut innghata a sukdam ti chau naw chu, chu hmuna chun thil- mak dang hrim a thaw thei nawh a.

en: And he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages teaching.
hmr: An awi nawna chu mak a ti hle a. Chun, inchûktir pum peiin khuohai chu a fang vêl a.

en: And he calleth unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and he gave them authority over the unclean spirits;
hmr: Chun, sâwm le pahni hai chu a ko a, pahni peiin a tir suok tah a; khawhri inthieng nawhai chunga thuneina a pêk bawk a.

en: and he charged them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no bread, no wallet, no money in their purse;
hmr: Chun, inzinnaa ding chun fung- hrawl chau naw chu iengkhawm– bei khawm, mansa khawm, an kâwng- khiah tangka khawm–châwi lo ding a ti tlat a,

en: but to go shod with sandals: and, said he, put not on two coats.
hmr: kekawk ruok chu bun ding a tih a. “Zakuo pahni hâk naw ro,” a ti bawk a.

en: And he said unto them, Wheresoever ye enter into a house, there abide till ye depart thence.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin an kuomah, “Khawlai khawm in tlungna ina chun chu hmuna inthawka in suok nâwk hmakhat chu, tlung zing pei ro.

en: And whatsoever place shall not receive you, and they hear you not, as ye go forth thence, shake off the dust that is under your feet for a testimony unto them.
hmr: Chun, khâwlai khuo khawmin an lâwm naw cheu a, in thu an ngâi nawna poah, chutaka inthawka in suok pha chun, anni inhriettirna dingin in kepha hnuoia pilvut kai chu thinthla ro,” a ta.

en: And they went out, and preached that men should repent.
hmr: Chuongchun, an fe suok a, mipuihai kuomah simna thu an hril a.

en: And they cast out many demons, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.
hmr: Khawhrihai tamtak an hnawt- suok a, damnaw tamtak khawm sahriek an nâl a, an sukdam bawk a.

en: And king Herod heard thereof; for his name had become known: and he said, John the Baptizer is risen from the dead, and therefore do these powers work in him.
hmr: Chun, lal Herod chun a lo hriet a, a hming chu a lo inthang ta sih a, “Baptistu Johan kha mithi laia inthawkin a hung tho nâwk tah a; chuleiin, chuong thilthawtheinahai chun amaa chun sin a thaw a ni chu,” a ta.

en: But others said, It is Elijah. And others said, It is a prophet, even as one of the prophets.
hmr: Mi dang ruok chun, “Elija a ni chu,” an ta; mi dangin, “Zâwlnei a ni chu, zâwlneihai laia pakhat ang kha,” an ta.

en: But Herod, when he heard thereof, said, John, whom I beheaded, he is risen.
hmr: Herod ruok chun a lo hrietin, “Johan, a lu ka itanpa ngei kha a hung tho nâwk a ni chu,” a ta.

en: For Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for the sake of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife; for he had married her.
hmr: Herod ngei chun a unaupa Philip nuhmei Herodi leiin mi a tir suok a, Johan chu ân mantir a, intângna inah phierin a lo khum ta sih a; Herodi chu nuhmeiin a lo nei ta leiin;

en: For John said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother’s wife.
hmr: Johan chun Herod kuomah, “I unaupa nuhmei i nei pêk hi a thieng naw a nih,” a lo ti ta bawk a.

en: And Herodias set herself against him, and desired to kill him; and she could not;
hmr: Chuleichun, Herodi chun ama chu a ngei naw rân el a, sukhlum a nuom a; nisienlakhawm, a thei si nawh a;

en: for Herod feared John, knowing that he was a righteous and holy man, and kept him safe. And when he heard him, he was much perplexed; and he heard him gladly.
hmr: Herodin Johan chu mi fel le mi inthiengtak a nih ti a hriet leiin ama chu a ṭih a, a hum tlat sih a, a thu a ngai chun a lunginzîng hle hlak a: nisienlakhawm, lâwm takin a ngai hlak a.

en: And when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, and the high captains, and the chief men of Galilee;
hmr: Chun, Herod chun a pieng ni champha phâk nia a mi ropuihai, sipai hotu lienhai dâm, Galili rama mi lienhai rawi ta dinga, zâna ruoi a ṭhe laiin hun remchâng a hung um tah a.

en: and when the daughter of Herodias herself came in and danced, she pleased Herod and them that sat at meat with him; and the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.
hmr: Herodi naunu ngei chu a hung lût a, a lâm a, Herod le a thlaithlêng awtpuituhai chu a suklâwm tah a; chuongchun, lal chun naupangnu kuoma chun, “I dit dit mi hni rawh, pêng ka ti che,” a ta.

en: And he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.
hmr: “Iengkhawm i mi hni phawt chu, ka ram chenve rau khawm pêng ka ti che,” tiin a kuomah a lo inkhâm ta bawk a.

en: And she went out, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptizer.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a suok a, a nu kuoma chun, “Ieng am hnîng ka ta?” a va ta. Chun, ama chun, “Baptistu Johan lu,” a lo ta.

en: And she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou forthwith give me on a platter the head of John the Baptist.
hmr: Chun, ama chu inhmawtakin lal kuoma chun a va lût nghâl tah a, “Thlêngin Baptistu Johan lu i mi pêk nghâl ka nuom a nih,” tîn a hnih a.

en: And the king was exceeding sorry; but for the sake of his oaths, and of them that sat at meat, he would not reject her.
hmr: Chun, lal chu a lungngai ta bêk bêk el a; nisienlakhawm, ân khâm- nahai le a thlaithlêng awtpuituhai lei chun a sêl nuom nawh a.

en: And straightway the king sent forth a soldier of his guard, and commanded to bring his head: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
hmr: Chun, lal chun a vêngtu sipai pakhat a tir nghâl tah a, a lu chu hung lâk ding thu a pêk a. Chun, ama chun intângna ina chun a lu a va tan a,

en: and brought his head on a platter, and gave it to the damsel; and the damsel gave it to her mother.
hmr: a lu chu thlêngin a hung lâk a, naupangnu kuoma chun a pêk a, ama chun a nu kuomah a pêk a.

en: And when his disciples heard thereof, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
hmr: Chun, a închûktirhai chun an hriet phingleh a ruong chu an vân hlawm a, thlânah an inzâl tah a.

en: And the apostles gather themselves together unto Jesus; and they told him all things, whatsoever they had done, and whatsoever they had taught.
hmr: Chun, tirkohai chu Isu kuomah an hung inkhâwm a, iengkim an thil thaw ta hai, an thu inchûktir tahai po po chu an hril a.

en: And he saith unto them, Come ye yourselves apart into a desert place, and rest a while. For there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Nangni rawi ngawtin thlalêr hmunah a tumin hung unla, châwl phawt ro,” a ta. (Mi tamtak an insûl zut zut a, bu takngiel khawm an fâk hman nghâl nawh a.)

en: And they went away in the boat to a desert place apart.
hmr: Chuongchun, thlalêr tieng lawngin a tumin an va fe tah a.

en: And the people saw them going, and many knew them, and they ran together there on foot from all the cities, and outwent them.
hmr: Chun, an va fe lai chu mipuihai chun an hmuh a, mi tamtakin anni chu an hriet a, khaw tina inthawkin chu hmuna chun kein an tlân khâwm a, an lo lekhal tah a.

en: And he came forth and saw a great multitude, and he had compassion on them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu a hung suok chun, mipui nasatak a hmuh a, vêngtu nei naw berâmhai ang an ni leiin a lunginsiet bêk bêk a; thu tamtak ân chûktir tah a.

en: And when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, The place is desert, and the day is now far spent;
hmr: Chun, khuo chu a hung inhnu ta hle a, a inchûktirhai chu a kuomah an hung a, “Ahi thlalêr hmun a na, khuo khawm ân hnu ta bawk nghâl a.

en: send them away, that they may go into the country and villages round about, and buy themselves somewhat to eat.
hmr: Anni rawi hi ei kâwl vêl loa dâm le khuoa dâm an fâk ding ieng amanih bêk an inchâwk theina dingin infetir tâwl ta la,” an ta.

en: But he answered and said unto them, Give ye them to eat. And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred shillings’ worth of bread, and give them to eat?
hmr: Ama ruok chun an kuomah, “Nangnîn fâk ding pe ta unla,” tiin a dawn a. Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Bei duli zahni man vân chawin fâk ding kan pêk ding am a nih?” an ta.

en: And he saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? go and see. And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Beiphêk iengzât am in nei a? hung en ta u,” a ta. Chun, an nei zât an hriet phingleh, “Panga, ngatê pahni leh,” an ta.

en: And he commanded them that all should sit down by companies upon the green grass.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, an rêngin hlo hring chunga chun apâwl peia inṭhungtir dingin an kuomah thu a pêk a.

en: And they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.
hmr: Chun, atlarin za khat dâm, sâwmnga dâm peiin an ṭhung tâwl a.

en: And he took the five loaves and the two fishes, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, and brake the loaves; and he gave to the disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.
hmr: Chun, ama chun bei panga le ngatê pahni chu a lâk a, vân tieng nghain mal a sâwm a, beiphêkhai chu a khawi a, mipui chu infâktir dingin a inchûktirhai kuomah a pêk a, ngate pahni khawm chu mi po po lai chun a sem a.

en: And they all ate, and were filled.
hmr: Chun, an rêngin an fâk a, an khawp tâwl tah a.

en: And they took up broken pieces, twelve basketfuls, and also of the fishes.
hmr: Chun, bei nâwi le nga nâwihai chu bâwm sâwm le pahni an rût sip a.

en: And they that ate the loaves were five thousand men.
hmr: Bei fatuhai chu patling ruok khawm sâng nga hiel an nih.

en: And straightway he constrained his disciples to enter into the boat, and to go before him unto the other side to Bethsaida, while he himself sendeth the multitude away.
hmr: Chun, ama ngeiin mipui chu ân ṭintir sûngin râl khing tienga Bethsaidaa lo fe hmasa dingin a inchûktirhai chu lawngah ân chuong tir nghâl tah a.

en: And after he had taken leave of them, he departed into the mountain to pray.
hmr: Chun, anni ân ṭintir hnung chun ṭawngṭai dingin tlangah a fe tah a.

en: And when even was come, the boat was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
hmr: Chun, zântieng inhnu deu a hung ni chun lawng chu dîl lai taka chun a lo um a, ama chu a khât chauin khawmuola chun a um a.

en: And seeing them distressed in rowing, for the wind was contrary unto them, about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking on the sea; and he would have passed by them:
hmr: Chun, an lawng kar chu an lung a zîng hlein a hmu a, thliin aninaw tieng panga a mût leiin. Vârṭien ding lai vêlin dil chunga kea lâwnin anni tieng a hung pan a, anni chu fe khêl a tum a.

en: but they, when they saw him walking on the sea, supposed that it was a ghost, and cried out;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, anni chun ama chu dîl chunga kea lâwn an hang hmu chun thlâ amanih an sâwn a, an khêk ta rak el a; an rêngin ama an hmuh a, an thlaphâng hle a.

en: for they all saw him, and were troubled. But he straightway spake with them, and saith unto them, Be of good cheer: it is I; be not afraid.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun anni chu a biek nghâl tah a, an kuomah, “Lungmuongtakin um ro, keima ka nih annâwm, ṭi naw ro,” a ti tah a.

en: And he went up unto them into the boat; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves;
hmr: Chun, lawnga chun an kuomah a hang chuong ve a, thli hrang chu a ma tah a; chuongchun, an lungril chun mak an ti hle a,

en: for they understood not concerning the loaves, but their heart was hardened.
hmr: bei thu kha a ngaina an hriet- thiem si nawh a, an lungril a ngar leiin.

en: And when they had crossed over, they came to the land unto Gennesaret, and moored to the shore.
hmr: Chun, râl khingtieng an kai chun Gennesaret ram, khawmuol an tlung a, vapanga chun lawng chu an thlung a.

en: And when they were come out of the boat, straightway the people knew him,
hmr: Chun, lawnga inthawka an suok chun, mihai chun ama chu an lo hriet nghâl tah a;

en: and ran round about that whole region, and began to carry about on their beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.
hmr: chu ram vêla chun an tlân vêl ta sup sup a, a um ti an hrietna taphawta chun damnawhai dâm an zâlphaa zâl pum zingin an zâwn vêl ta ruoi el a.

en: And wheresoever he entered, into villages, or into cities, or into the country, they laid the sick in the marketplaces, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.
hmr: Chun, khaw chînhaia dâm, khaw lienhaia dâm, lohaia dâm, khawlai a lûtna taphawta chun damnawhai chu dâwr hmuna dâm an inzâltir tâwl a; a puon hmawr bêk khawm them thei an hnih a. Chuongchun, ama tâwk po chu an dam pei tah a.

en: And there are gathered together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, who had come from Jerusalem,
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai le Dân inchûk- tirtuhai laia mi tuhai amanih Jerusalema inthawka hunghai chu a kuomah an hung inkhâwm a.

en: and had seen that some of his disciples ate their bread with defiled, that is, unwashen, hands.
hmr: Chuonghai chun a închûktir aṭhenhaiin kut bala bei an fâk an lo hmuh tah a. Bal ti hi sâwplo tina a nih.

en: (For the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands diligently, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders;
hmr: (Pharisaihai thurosie chu an pawm tlat leiin an kut fâitaka an sâwp naw chun an fâk ngai si nawh a.

en: and when they come from the marketplace, except they bathe themselves, they eat not; and many other things there are, which they have received to hold, washings of cups, and pots, and brasen vessels.)
hmr: Chun, dâwr hmuna inthawk an inlâwi khawmin an insil naw chun an fâk ngai nawh a. Chun, thu dang tamtak pawm tlat ding an lâksâwnghai chu a um a, nohai, bêlhai, sumbêlhai sâwp hai ang hi.)

en: And the Pharisees and the scribes ask him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat their bread with defiled hands?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharisaihai le Dân inchûktirtuhai chun, “Iengdinga i închûktirhai hin ruolhlui thurosie ang peia um loa kut bala bei an fâk el hlak am a na?” tiin an indawn a.

en: And he said unto them, Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, This people honoreth me with their lips, But their heart is far from me.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Isai hin nangni mi vervêkhai thu a lo hrillâwk dik zet el– ‘Hi hairawi hin an bauin an mîn pâk a, An lungril ruok chun an mi hlat sih a.

en: But in vain do they worship me, Teaching as their doctrines the precepts of men.
hmr: An inchûktirnaa mihriem thupêkhai an inchûktir leiin, An mi biek khawm hi a thlâwn el a nih,’ ti ziek ang khan.

en: Ye leave the commandment of God, and hold fast the tradition of men.
hmr: Pathien thupêkhai chu lung- kham loin, mihriem thurosie chu in chel tlat a ni hi,” a ta.

en: And he said unto them, Full well do ye reject the commandment of God, that ye may keep your tradition.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin an kuom- ah, “Nangni thurosiehai in pawm theina dingin Pathien thupêkhai chu in dit naw hi, rem chu in hriet ngawt hi aw!

en: For Moses said, Honor thy father and thy mother; and, He that speaketh evil of father or mother, let him die the death:
hmr: Mosiein, ‘I nu le pa chawimawi rawh,’ ‘Tukhawm a nu amanih, a pa amanih hrilse taphawt chu thi mawl raw se,’ a ti sih a;

en: but ye say, If a man shall say to his father or his mother, That wherewith thou mightest have been profited by me is Corban, that is to say, Given to God;
hmr: nangni ruok chun hieng hin in ti hlak a, ‘Mîn a nu amanih, a pa amani kuomah, I mi sawrna ding hi Korban a ni tah,’ a ti chun, (chu chu Pathien kuoma pêk tina a nih),

en: ye no longer suffer him to do aught for his father or his mother;
hmr: a nu amanih, a pa amani ta dingin iengkhawm a thawpêk in phal ta ngai nawh a;

en: making void the word of God by your tradition, which ye have delivered: and many such like things ye do.
hmr: in thurosie peksâwng hin Pathien thu chu in baw hmang hlak a nih; chuong ang chu tamtak in thaw hlak,” a ta.

en: And he called to him the multitude again, and said unto them, Hear me all of you, and understand:
hmr: Chun, mipui chu a ko nâwk a, an kuomah, “In rêngin ka thu hi lo ngâi seng unla, a ngâi lo thiem ta u;

en: there is nothing from without the man, that going into him can defile him; but the things which proceed out of the man are those that defile the man.
hmr: Mihriem puotienga inthawka a phîng sûnga lût ama sukthieng naw thei iengkhawm a um nawh, mihriem phîng sûnga inthawka hung suokhai chu mihriem sukthieng nawtu an ni lem a nih,” a ta.
[Tukhawm hrietna dinga na nei chun hre raw se.]

en: And when he was entered into the house from the multitude, his disciples asked of him the parable.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu ina a lûtsan hnungin, a inchûktirhaiin tekhithu chu ama an indawn fel a.

en: And he saith unto them, Are ye so without understanding also? Perceive ye not, that whatsoever from without goeth into the man, it cannot defile him;
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Nangni khawm chuong ang lâwma hrietna nei naw in ni maw? Hi hi in hriet naw maw? Iengkhawm puo- tienga inthawka mihriem sûnga lût po chun ama a sukthiengnaw thei nawh;

en: because it goeth not into his heart, but into his belly, and goeth out into the draught? This he said, making all meats clean.
hmr: a lungrila lût loin, a phîngah a lût a, inhnâwmnaah a suok lem hlak leiin, ti hi?” a ta. (Chu chu fâkding tin rêng fâk a thieng, a tina a nih.)

en: And he said, That which proceedeth out of the man, that defileth the man.
hmr: Chun, ama bâwkin, “Mihriem phîng sûnga inthawka hung suok chun, chu tak chun mihriem a sukthieng naw hlak a nih.

en: For from within, out of the heart of men, evil thoughts proceed, fornications, thefts, murders, adulteries,
hmr: Sûng tienga um mihriem lungrila inthawkhai chun, ngaituona suol dâm a hung suok hlak nghâl a; inditna dâm, inrûkna dâm, tuol- thatna dâm, uirena dâm,

en: covetings, wickednesses, deceit, lasciviousness, an evil eye, railing, pride, foolishness:
hmr: inhnarna dâm, suolna dâm, hlêmna dâm, hurna dâm, îtsîkna dâm, hrilsietna dâm, chapona dâm le invêtna dâm hi;

en: all these evil things proceed from within, and defile the man.
hmr: chuong suolhai po po chu sûngtienga inthawkin a hung suok a, mihriem chu a sukthieng naw hlak a nih,” a ta.

en: And from thence he arose, and went away into the borders of Tyre and Sidon. And he entered into a house, and would have no man know it; and he could not be hid.
hmr: Chun, a tho a, chutaka inthawk chun Tura le Sidon bielah a fe tah a, chun, inah a lût a, tu ihriet khawm a nuom nawh a; nisienlakhawm, ân thup thei si nawh.

en: But straightway a woman, whose little daughter had an unclean spirit, having heard of him, came and fell down at his feet.
hmr: Chuongchun, nuhmei pakhat naunu khawhri inthieng naw iman nei chun a chanchin a lo hriet a, a ke bulah a va bawkkhup nghâl tah a.

en: Now the woman was a Greek, a Syrophoenician by race. And she besought him that he would cast forth the demon out of her daughter.
hmr: Chu nuhmei chu Grik mi a na, insiengna tieng chu Surophoiniki mi a nih. Ama chun a naunu sûnga khawhri hnawt dawk dingin a ngên a.

en: And he said unto her, Let the children first be filled: for it is not meet to take the children’s bread and cast it to the dogs.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a kuomah, “Nauhai chu khawp hmasa phawt raw hai se, nauhai bei lâkpêk a, uihai kuoma pêk a mawi nawh ie,” a ta.

en: But she answered and saith unto him, Yea, Lord; even the dogs under the table eat of the children’s crumbs.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, ni chu a nih; nisienlakhawm, dawkân hnuoia uihai khawmin nauhai bei nâwi chu an fâk hlak annâwm,” tiin a dawn a.

en: And he said unto her, For this saying go thy way; the demon is gone out of thy daughter.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “I thu hril lei chun fe ta raw le; khawhri chu i naunu sûnga inthawkin a suok tah,” a ta.

en: And she went away unto her house, and found the child laid upon the bed, and the demon gone out.
hmr: Chun, a ina chun a fe tah a, a nau chu khawhri isuoksan zoa khuma zâl a va hmu tah a.

en: And again he went out from the borders of Tyre, and came through Sidon unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the borders of Decapolis.
hmr: Chun, Tura rama inthawkin a suok nâwk a, Sidon khuo sirin Dekapoli ram fe thleng peiin Galili dîl chu a tlung tah a.

en: And they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to lay his hand upon him.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat nasêt, ṭawng khawm ṭawng fel thei lo hi a kuomah an hung ṭhuoi a, a chunga a kut innghat dingin an ngên a.

en: And he took him aside from the multitude privately, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spat, and touched his tongue;
hmr: Chun, ama chun mipui laia chu, a khât chauin a tumin a ṭhuoi a, a kutpârhaiin a nakuo chu a khîkpêk a, chil a sâk a, a lei a them pêk a.

en: and looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha, that is, Be opened.
hmr: Chun, vân tieng nghain ân thuok huoi a, a kuomah, “Ephatha,” a ta. Chu chu, “Lo inhawng rawh,” tina a nih.

en: And his ears were opened, and the bond of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
hmr: Chuongchun, a nahai chu a hung inhawng a, a lei khitna khawm chu a hung insût a, chiengtakin a ṭawng thei tah a.

en: And he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah tukhawm hril lo ding a ti tlat a; nisienlakhawm, a khap nasa deu leh, an khêk vêl pui nasa hman hlak a.

en: And they were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well; he maketh even the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
hmr: “Ama chun iengkim ṭhatakin a thawh a; nasêt dâm a sukvarpêk a, ṭawng thei naw dâm khawm ân ṭawngtir hlak,” an ta, mak an ti nasa bêk bêk a.

en: In those days, when there was again a great multitude, and they had nothing to eat, he called unto him his disciples, and saith unto them,
hmr: Chuong lai chun mipui tamtak an hung um nâwk a, chuonga fâk ding iengkhawm an nei naw lai chun, ama chun a închûktirhai chu a ko a, an kuomah,

en: I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat:
hmr: “Tûn mipuihai hi ka kuomah ni thum an um tah a, fâk ding ieng- khawm an nei naw leiin ka lunginsiet bêk bêk a nih.

en: and if I send them away fasting to their home, they will faint on the way; and some of them are come from far.
hmr: Bu ngheia an in tieng kân fetir el chun, lam kâr lakah an châu ding a ni sih a, a ṭhen lem chu an hungna a hla hle sih a,” a ta.

en: And his disciples answered him, Whence shall one be able to fill these men with bread here in a desert place?
hmr: Chun, a închuktirhai chun, “Tuin am hienghai rawi hi sukkhawp thei an ta?” tiin ama an dawn a.

en: And he asked them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Beiphêk iengzât am in nei a?” tiin anni chu ân dawn a. Chun, anni chun, “Phêk sari,” an ta.

en: And he commandeth the multitude to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and having given thanks, he brake, and gave to his disciples, to set before them; and they set them before the multitude.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu hnuoia ṭhung dingin thu a pêk a, chuong- chun, bei phêk sari chu a lâk a, lâwmthu a hril zoin a khawi a; anni laia sem dingin a închûktirhai a pêk a; chuongchun, mipui lai chun an sem tah a.

en: And they had a few small fishes: and having blessed them, he commanded to set these also before them.
hmr: Ngatê tlâwmte an nei bawk a, ama chun chu khawm chu mal a sâwm a, chuonghai khawm chu mipui laia sem ding thu a pêk a.

en: And they ate, and were filled: and they took up, of broken pieces that remained over, seven baskets.
hmr: Chuongchun, an fâk a, an khawp tâwl tah a; an fâk mahla nawi khawm chu bâwmrâng sari zet an rût sip a.

en: And they were about four thousand: and he sent them away.
hmr: Anni rawi chu sâng li lai an na; ama chun anni chu ân ṭintir tah a.

en: And straightway he entered into the boat with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a închûktirhai lai lawngah a chuong nghâl tah a. Dalmanutha ram chu a tlung tah a.

en: And the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, trying him.
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai an hung a, ama fiena dingin amaa vâna inthawka inchikna zawngin ama chu an sêl tah a.

en: And he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why doth this generation seek a sign? verily I say unto you, There shall no sign be given unto this generation.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a lungrilah nasatakin ân rûm a, “Iengdinga tulaia ruoltharhai hin inchikna an zawng am a na? Titakzetin ka hril cheu, tulai ruoltharhai kuoma hin inchikna hrim hrim pêk ni naw ni,” a ta.

en: And he left them, and again entering into the boat departed to the other side.
hmr: Chun, anni chu a mâksan a, râl khing tieng a fe tah a.

en: And they forgot to take bread; and they had not in the boat with them more than one loaf.
hmr: Chun, a închûktirhai chun bei an chawi theinghil a, bei phêk khat chau naw chu lawnga chun bei dang hrim hrim an nei si nawh a.

en: And he charged them, saying, Take heed, beware of the leaven of the Pharisees and the leaven of Herod.
hmr: Chun, ama chun, “Pharisaihai chawl le Herod chawla chun invêng ṭha unla, ṭi dêkin um ro,” a ti tlat a.

en: And they reasoned one with another, saying, We have no bread.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, “Bei ei nei dêr nawh a,” tîn an in ngaituoh a.

en: And Jesus perceiving it saith unto them, Why reason ye, because ye have no bread? do ye not yet perceive, neither understand? have ye your heart hardened?
hmr: Chun, Isûn chu chu a lo hriet a, an kuomah, “Bei in nei naw leisek chun iengdinga in inngaituo am? Tu khawm hin in lungrilin in la hriet rawp naw maw? In lungril chu in sukngar ta am a nih?

en: Having eyes, see ye not? and having ears, hear ye not? and do ye not remember?
hmr: Mit nei zing siin in hmu nâwm a nih? Na nei zing siin in hriet nâwm a nih? In hriet zing ta naw a ni maw?

en: When I brake the five loaves among the five thousand, how many baskets full of broken pieces took ye up? They say unto him, Twelve.
hmr: Sâng nga laia bei phêk nga ka khawi lai khan a nâwi kha bâwm iengzât am in rût sip kha? In la hriet zing naw maw?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Sâwm le pahni,” an ta.

en: And when the seven among the four thousand, how many basketfuls of broken pieces took ye up? And they say unto him, Seven.
hmr: Chun, “Sâng li laia pasari ka khawi khan a nâwi kha bâwmrâng iengzât am in rût sip a?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Bâwmrâng sari,” an ta.

en: And he said unto them, Do ye not yet understand?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Tu khawm hin a ngaina in la hriet rawp naw maw?” a ti tah a.

en: And they come unto Bethsaida. And they bring to him a blind man, and beseech him to touch him.
hmr: Chun, Bethsaida chu an hung tlung a. Chun, a kuomah mitdel an hung ṭhuoi a, ama chu them dingin Isu an ngên a.

en: And he took hold of the blind man by the hand, and brought him out of the village; and when he had spit on his eyes, and laid his hands upon him, he asked him, Seest thou aught?
hmr: Chun, ama chun mitdel kut chu a chel a, khaw kâwl tieng a fepui a; chun, a mita chun chil a sâk a, a chungah a kut ân nghat zoin, “I hmu thei ta?” tîn ân dawn a.

en: And he looked up, and said, I see men; for I behold them as trees, walking.
hmr: Chun, a hang tang a, “Mihriem chu ka hmuh a, anachu thing lâwn angin ka hmuh,” a ta.

en: Then again he laid his hands upon his eyes; and he looked stedfastly, and was restored, and saw all things clearly.
hmr: Chun, a mita chun a kut ân nghat nawk a, chuongchun, ama chun a en zing a, a hung dam el tah a, iengkim chiengtakin a hmu thei tah a.

en: And he sent him away to his home, saying, Do not even enter into the village.
hmr: Chun, Isu chun, “Khuoa khawm hin lût ta naw la,” tîn a in tieng ân fetir tah a.

en: And Jesus went forth, and his disciples, into the villages of Cæsarea Philippi: and on the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Who do men say that I am?
hmr: Chun, Isu le a închûktirhai chu an fe suok a, Philip Kaisari khawperhaia chun an feh a; chun, fe malamin a închûktirhai kuomah, “Mihaiin tu am a nih an mi tih a?” tiin ân dawn a.

en: And they told him, saying, John the Baptist; and others, Elijah; but others, One of the prophets.
hmr: Anni chun, “ ‘Baptistu Johan an ti cheh a’; mi dangin ‘Elija,’ a ṭhen ruok chun, ‘Zâwlnei tu amanih’ an ti cheh a,” tiin an hril a.

en: And he asked them, But who say ye that I am? Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Anleh, nangnîn tu am a nih in mi tih a?” tîn ân dawn a; Peter chun a kuomah, “Krista chu i nih,” tîn a dawn a.

en: And he charged them that they should tell no man of him.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a chanchin thu chu tukhawm hril lo ding a ti tlat a.

en: And he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected by the elders, and the chief priests, and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
hmr: Chun, Mihriem Naupa chun thil tamtak a tuor dingzie dâm, upahai, thiempu lalhai le, Dân inchûktir- tuhai dit nawa a um ding dâm, sukhluma a la um ding dâm, ni thum hnunga a thonâwk dingzie dâm anni ân chûktir phut tah a.

en: And he spake the saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.
hmr: Chuong thu chu chiengtakin a hril a. Chun, Peter chun ama chu a tumin a ṭhuoi a, a kâwk a.

en: But he turning about, and seeing his disciples, rebuked Peter, and saith, Get thee behind me, Satan; for thou mindest not the things of God, but the things of men.
hmr: Ama ruok chu a ngha kîr a, a închûktirhai chu a en a, “Setan, ka hnungah fe rawh. Pathien thilhai ngaituo loin, mihriem thilhai i ngaituo a ni hi,” tîn Peter chu a kâwk tah a.

en: And he called unto him the multitude with his disciples, and said unto them, If any man would come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.
hmr: Chun, mipuihai chu a închûk- tirhai le chun a ko a, an kuomah, “Tukhawm a mi zui nuom chun mâni inhnâwlin, a kraws putin mi zui raw se.

en: For whosoever would save his life shall lose it; and whosoever shall lose his life for my sake and the gospel’s shall save it.
hmr: Tukhawm ama hringna sanhim nuom chun chân a tih. Tukhawm keia lei le Chanchin Ṭha leia hringna chân chun sanhim a tih.

en: For what doth it profit a man, to gain the whole world, and forfeit his life?
hmr: Mîn khawvêl hi a pumin nei sienla, a hringna chân si sienla, ieng am ṭhahnem a ta?

en: For what should a man give in exchange for his life?
hmr: Mîn a hringna sikin ieng am pe thei a ta?

en: For whosoever shall be ashamed of me and of my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of man also shall be ashamed of him, when he cometh in the glory of his Father with the holy angels.
hmr: Tukhawm tulai ruolthar uire le suksuol hmanghai laia kei le ka thu inzapuihai po chu, Mihriem Naupa hin vântirko inthienghai le a Pa ropuinaa inthuoma a hung pha chun, ama chu hung inzapui ve thung a tih,” a ta

en: And he said unto them, Verily I say unto you, There are some here of them that stand by, who shall in no wise taste of death, till they see the kingdom of God come with power.
hmr: Chun, ama bawkin an kuomah, “Titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, hitaka ngîr aṭhenhai hi Pathien ram chu thilthawtheina le a hung tlung an hmu hmâkhat chu thina intem tawp naw ding an um,” a ta.

en: And after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and bringeth them up into a high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them;
hmr: Chun, ni ruk hnungin Isûn Peter hai, Jakob hai, Johan hai, chu a ṭhuoi a, a tumin tlâng insângtakah anni chau chu a hang fepui a, an hmaa chun a hmêl umzie chu a hung dang- lam tah a.

en: and his garments became glistering, exceeding white, so as no fuller on earth can whiten them.
hmr: Chuongchun, a silfênhai chu hnuoia puon sâwptu hrim hrimin an sâwp vâr thei naw ding khawp rakin a hung vâr a, a hung tle ta sur el a.

en: And there appeared unto them Elijah with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
hmr: Chun, Elija le Mosie chu an kuomah an hung inlâr a, Isu le chun an inbiek tah a.

en: And Peter answereth and saith to Jesus, Rabbi, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elijah.
hmr: Chun, Peterin Isu a biek a, “Rabbi, ei ta dingin hitaka um hi a ṭha; bâwkte pathum khâwng ei ta, I ta dingin pakhat, Mosie ta dingin pakhat, Elija ta dingin pakhat,” a ta.

en: For he knew not what to answer; for they became sore afraid.
hmr: An ṭi bêk bêk leiin hril ding mumal a hriet si nawh a.

en: And there came a cloud overshadowing them: and there came a voice out of the cloud, This is my beloved Son: hear ye him.
hmr: Chun, anni chu hliein sûm a hung suok a, “Ahi ka Naupa dittak a nih, ama thu ngai ro,” a ta.

en: And suddenly looking round about, they saw no one any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
hmr: Chun, an hang en vêl vak a, Isu chau naw chu tukhawm an kuomah chun an hmu ta nawh a.

en: And as they were coming down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, save when the Son of man should have risen again from the dead.
hmr: Chun, tlânga inthawk an ṭum laiin, Mihriem Naupa mithi laia a thonâwk hnunga chau naw chu an iengkhat hmuhai chu tukhawm hril naw ding a ti tlat a.

en: And they kept the saying, questioning among themselves what the rising again from the dead should mean.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu thu chu an vawng zing a, “Mithi laia a thonâwk chu ieng tina am nîng a ta?” tiin anni rawi chu an indawn tuo hlak a.

en: And they asked him, saying, How is it that the scribes say that Elijah must first come?
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Iengdinga Dân inchûktirtuhaiin ‘Elija a hung hmasa ding a nih,’ ti am an na?” tîn an indawn a.

en: And he said unto them, Elijah indeed cometh first, and restoreth all things: and how is it written of the Son of man, that he should suffer many things and be set at nought?
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Elija chu hung hmasa hrim a ta, iengkim a siem ṭha ding a nih: thil tamtak tuorin, mi hmusitin a um ding a nih ti Mihriem Naupa chanchin iengtiziea ziek am an na?

en: But I say unto you, that Elijah is come, and they have also done unto him whatsoever they would, even as it is written of him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ka hril cheu hi: Elija chu a hung ta a nih. Chun, a chanchin an ziek ang ngei khan, a chungah an nuom nuomin an thaw ta hrim bawk a,” a ta.

en: And when they came to the disciples, they saw a great multitude about them, and scribes questioning with them.
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai kuom an zuk tlung chun, an vêla mipui nasatakhai le Dân inchûktirtuhaiin an lo sêl lai an zu hmuh a.

en: And straightway all the multitude, when they saw him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
hmr: Chun, mipui po po chun ama an hmu phing chun mak an ti hle a, a kuom tieng an tlân tâwl a, chibai an va bûk a.

en: And he asked them, What question ye with them?
hmr: Chun, ama chun an kuomah, “Annihai rawi leh ieng thu am a na in insêl?” tîn ân dawn a.

en: And one of the multitude answered him, Teacher, I brought unto thee my son, who hath a dumb spirit;
hmr: Mipui laia mi pakhatin an kuomah, “Inchuktirtu, ka naupa khawhri ṭawng thei naw iman chu i kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi a.
